texts.en: David remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, David like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, David,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  David expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, David is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en: Yakubu remembers not being able to pay school fees  during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Yakubu like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Yakubu,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Yakubu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, Yakubu is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computer merchandise for resale

loans.name: Umeda

texts.en: Umeda is a kind woman who is married and has three children. She lives with her family in the southern part of Tajikistan. Ten years ago, Umeda began her own business growing crops. Her husband is her business partner. Umeda grows melon, watermelon, vegetables and other crops. The whole area of her farm is 11 hectares. She works there from early morning. Also she uses rental workers. Umeda now is going to make the second sowing and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy seed and mineral fertilizer. She is going to sow the seeds of onion, maize and cotton. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seed and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Jonathan Orlando

texts.es: Jonathan de 21 años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Él es un hombre tenaz que a pesar de su corta edad se gana la vida de diferentes maneras tales como: viernes y sábado por la noche trabaja en servicio al cliente en un centro de entretenimiento, 2 días de la semana trabaja lavando vehículos en un local y los días restantes trabaja de jornalero en una finca cercana. Jonathan desea hacer un patio en su vivienda para que su hija tenga un lugar limpio donde distraerse por lo que solicita a FUSAI un crédito para comprar cemento, arena y grava para encementar, y lámina galvanizada, polines y pernos para el techo del patio.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 21 years old and lives with his partner and 3 year old daughter. He is a tenacious man who, in spite of his young age, earns a living in many ways. He works in customer service in an entertainment centre Friday and Saturday night, then spends two days a week washing cars in a local establishment and the remaining days he spends working as a day labourer in a nearby farm.

Jonathan would like to create a patio in his house so that his daughter can have a clean area to play in. This is why he has applied for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand and gravel to make concrete and to buy galvanised sheeting, lumber and bolts for the roof over the patio.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to make concrete and to buy galvanised sheeting, lumber and bolts for the roof over the patio

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a gas stove

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a business selling used shoes in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of used shoes to sell.

Letecia has been in this business for five years now.

Letecia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of used shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase chicks and stock feeds

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es una mujer de 33 años quien es agricultora por descendencia familiar la cual está acompañada siendo su conyugue también agricultor y apoyo principal en las diferentes actividades que son llevadas a cabo en el campo. Ella es madre de tres hijos quienes ayudan a sus padres en el campo y en el hogar pero solo uno de ellos estudia en la escuela de la comunidad. Su mayor fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia es la siembra y cultivo de café pero también en pequeña escala se dedica a la apicultura desde hace varios años teniendo esta actividad como otra pequeña fuente de ingresos aprendiendo varias actividades por medio de sus padres quienes le enseñaron todo sobre la crianza de abejas y cultivo de café. La tierra que cultiva y donde tiene sus apiarios fue comprada a sus suegros siendo la cual está ubicada a 3 kilómetros aproximadamente siendo sus clientes las bodegas, beneficios, intermediarios entre otros para la venta del grano de café y los diferentes vecinos para la venta de la miel en botella. Ella solicita financiamiento para poder comprar insumos como fertilizantes, abonos, foliares, entre otros que ayudaran a dar protección y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. Entre sus planes esta la construcción de un beneficio para almacenar, procesar y hacer la acción de compra/venta de café. En cuanto a su familia ella desea se superen y poder ayudarles con sus estudios para que puedan quedar administrando el negocio de la familia mejorando su calidad de vida y la de sus futuros hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a 33-year-old woman who is a farmer, like her family before her. Her partner is also a farmer and her principal support for the activities she carries out in the fields. She is a mother to three children, who help their parents in the fields and in the home. Only one of them studies in the local school. 

Her main source of economic income for her family comes from sowing and growing coffee, but she has also worked as a beekeeper on a small scale for several years. She does this as another small source of income and learned the trade from her parents, who taught her everything about bee-keeping and about growing coffee. The land she farms and where she has her apiaries was bought from her parents-in-law and is around 3 kilometers away. Her customers are general stores, brokers and intermediaries among others for the sale of coffee beans and various neighbors for the sale of bottles of honey.

She is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilizers, manure and foliares (plant fertilizers that are absorbed through the leaves) among others, which will help to protect and maintain her coffee crops. 

Her plans include building a brokerage to store, process and buy and sell coffee. In terms of her family she wants them to move forward and to be able to help them with their studies so that they can continue running the family business, improving their quality of life and that of their future children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: Munavara

texts.en:
Munavara is a 55-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three adult children.
She is a teacher who has worked in a local school for more than 17 years. She has had a great experience teaching. She earns a small salary that does not allow her to provide for the needs of her family. She would like to build a new house because her family is large and needs more room. This year she is going to build a new house with modern planning. Her elder son wants to get married to a lovely girl this year and they will live in the new house.

This loan will help her buy building materials to build a new house. In this way she will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new house

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia, 50 years of age, is married to a farmer and they're blessed with three children. She manages a hog-raising business in their village and earns a net income of PHP 3,500 for every hog sold. Due to insufficient funds, she would like a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and improve.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 59 years old and married with seven children. Luciana works very hard to provide for her family.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, cereals, coffee, creamer, seasonings, and noodles to sell.

Luciana has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, snack foods, cereals, coffee, creamer, seasonings, and noodles to sell

loans.name: Dandila

texts.en: Dandila is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Dandila joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Isiya,Thomas, and Musa. Dandila is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Dandila will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Dandila can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Dandila is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, one in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Mary has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her clients. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy weaves, conditioners, and shampoo for her beauty salon business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy weaves, conditioners,and shampoo for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Johana

texts.es:
Johana es una joven muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Hace algunos años se dedicaba a la venta de productos por catalogo como ropa, accesorios, artículos de belleza y elementos para el hogar, estos productos los vendía principalmente a amigos, vecinos y familiares.

Por algunos motivos personales se vio en la obligación de dejar la actividad y se dedico a otras cosas.
Hoy en día desea retomar nuevamente este oficio ya que desde muy niña sintió gran afinidad con el comercio y las ventas, por lo que hoy en día tiene grandes ilusiones e ideas en este campo gracias a su simpatía y excelente calidad de servicio.

Solicita un préstamo para comprar mercancía variada que le permita reiniciar con esta actividad y comenzar de cero, entre la mercancía se puede destacar ropa, accesorios para el hogar, productos de belleza, entre otros.

Tiene la esperanza de poder salir adelante gracias al apoyo de las personas de buen corazón que apoyan este tipo de proyectos.
texts.en:
Johana is very enterprising young woman who has a great desire to get ahead and progress in life.

Some years ago she began selling products from a catalogue such as clothing, accessories, beauty products and home accessories. She sold these products mostly to friends, neighbours and family. For personal reasons she was forced to stop this line of work and take up other activities instead. 

Right now Johana hopes to pick up this job again as ever since she was a child she has felt a great affinity with business and sales, which is why today she has grand illusions and big ideas for this job, thanks to her friendliness and her excellent quality of service.

She is applying for a loan to buy a variety of merchandise which will allow her to begin this job again, starting from zero. The merchandise that she would like to buy includes clothing, home accessories and beauty products, amongst others.

Johana has hope that she will get ahead thanks to the help of people with a good heart who support these type of projects.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start her own business

loans.name: Andrawus

texts.en: Andrawus is a 30-year-old farmer from Ung/Dutse.  As a Babban Gona member, Andrawus, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Andrawus can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Andrawus is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Andrawus said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Joshua, Inusa,and Anas, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children who are all in school. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for three years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Amina's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to sell charcoal, juice and ice cubes, bought a refrigerator and started selling fruits and vegetables. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loans and appreciates Kiva for supporting her group. She used the profit to buy a cupboard and a radio, pay school fees and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the missing items in her fresh produce business. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group DDC which consist of three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her fresh produce business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 23 years old, married and the mother of two children, one of whom is currently in school. She earns a living by raising pigs and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business. Ruth has been in this line of work for four years, and has taken out and repaid four prior loans. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 28 years old, married, and has one child who is currently in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Mary Ann has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Mary Ann would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Al- Shar Al-Careem Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Shar Al-Careem. It is composed of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.

Warda is the leader of the group. She is a 59-year-old married woman with six children. Her oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest is 19 years old. She lives with her family in their own house. Warda works as a housewife and she is very dynamic woman. Her husband is an employee of a public sector company. The salary which he receives from his work is a small and it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. Their house needs an interior renovation. Most of the bedrooms, the kitchen and the bathroom need renovating. This negatively affects Warda's feelings because she feels ashamed when visitors come to her house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase cement to renovate the house.

Warda hopes to renovate all her house and rent it to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate the interior of her house.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
El joven Camilo desde muy niño conoció y se dedico a las funciones del campo tales como agricultura y ganadería gracias al apoyo y habilidades que le enseño su padre para su supervivencia.

Hoy en día su actividad principal es la ganadería y tiene como objetivo aumentar su capital comprando aun mas lotes de ganado que le permitan abastecerse y generar mejores ingresos. Vive con sus padres a quien tiene muchas cosas que agradecerles y por eso busca recursos para colaborarles con los gastos de la casa.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar ganado y aumentar su negocio.

Sueña con poder ser un gran empresario y moverse en el mundo agrícola y ganadero, sueños que puede cumplir con mucha perseverancia y apoyo.

Todos los días asiste su negocio y procura por hacer las cosas muy bien.
texts.en:
Ever since he was very young Camilo has learnt about and worked in the fields of agriculture and cattle, thanks to the help and skills that his father passed on to him as his supervisor.

These days he mainly works with cattle. His goal is to increase his capital by purchasing even more lots of cattle which will allow him to how to stock up and generate a greater income. Camilo lives with his parents who have given him many things to be grateful for, which is why he wants to look for ways in which he can help them out with the household costs.

The loan that Camilo has applied for is to buy cattle and expand his business. He dreams of being a great businessman who moves in the agricultural and cattle world; dreams which he can realise through a lot of perseverance and support. He goes to work every day to ensure that everything is done well.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Ngina

texts.en: Ngina is a widow who is 62 years old and blessed with five grown children. She earns a living as a farmer, and has been in this line of work for 40 years. She earns about Kshs. 5,000 a month, and  has requested her first loan from VisionFund Kenya for Kshs.10,000, which she will use to buy fertilizer and manure for her farm. Ngina will use the profit she expects to earn to buy cattle. Her hope and dream for the future is to live a happy life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Ry Group

texts.en: Ry is 48 years old, a farmer and a widowed woman with three children. She has been a farmer since 2007. One of her children is a driver and another is a student. They live in Tbong Khmum Province, Cambodia. Her family can earn approximately $12 per day. Now Ry would like a loan as a member of a group of four. She will use her loan portion to buy concrete sewers to build a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions and avoid illnesses. In the future, she is going to expand her cultivation and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: to buy concrete sewers to build a latrine

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 51 years old, married and has two children who are both in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Merlinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlinda has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a married mother and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business but she dreams of opening a hotel in the near future when her business grows. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Giovanny Arley

texts.es:
Giovanny es un hombre muy dedicado y trabajador, gran amante de su familia y muy responsable con sus hijos.
Hace 6 años realizo un curso de mantenimiento de piscinas trabajando activamente en una entidad pública del municipio de La Ceja, pero hace aproximadamente 4 años, decidió independizarse y trabajar con entidades del sector privado y para personas particulares.
Encuentra la gran ventaja de ser independiente y manejar su propio ritmo y estilo de trabajo.
El desea mejorar la prestación de su servicios, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunas herramientas como un carro con aspirador, una manguera, un tubo telescópico, un bomba sumergible y una motocicleta para transportarse.
Estos elementos le permitirán a Giovanny continuar con su labor y continuar llevando el sustento a su casa ya que es el único medio de ingresos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Giovanny is a very dedicated and hard working man, a great lover of his family and very responsible with his children.

6 years ago, he completed a course in pool maintenance, actively working in a public pool in the municipality of La Ceja, but about 4 years ago, decided to become independent and work with the private sector and individuals.

He finds it a great advantage to be independent and manage his own pace and work style. He wants to improve the delivery of his services, therefore he is asking for a loan to buy some tools such as a cart with vacuum cleaner, a hose, a telescopic tube, a submersible pump and a motorcycle for transportation.

These elements will allow Giovanny to continue his work and continue to bring support to his house because it is the only means of income in his home.

loans.use: to buy tools and a motorbike

loans.name: Isiyaku

texts.en: Isiyaku is a 30-year-old farmer from Ung/Dutse.  As a Babban Gona member, Isiyaku, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Isiyaku can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Isiyaku is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Isiyaku said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Obadiya, Keziya,and Obida, and in 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Amal Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower of Amal group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. They have long been neighbors and friends and they all work hard to make a living.
Amal is pictured at the far left side with her face covered with a white veil. She is a 58-year-old married mother of three. She has been working hard for 12 years to provide her family with the daily necessities.
Amal is a baker and her bakery is well known in her region. She makes a special quality of bread and tasty manakish (breakfast flatbread) for her loyal customers. She works hard to support her husband in covering their living expenses. Her family comes first and she believes that she and her husband have to work hard for a better future.
Her acquired loan will be invested in expanding her business. She will buy extra flour, oil and necessary raw materials to increase her bakery's production.
She hopes to keep on expanding her business in a well-managed way and diversify her production.
As for the other group members, Ayram is on the right, while Hind is in the center of the picture.

loans.use: To buy flour, oil and necessary raw materials to increase her bakery's production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bulk grains such as rice and beans, as well as oil, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks and lollies, amongst others.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.en: Feruza is kind woman who is 31 years old and widowed. Her husband died some years ago and she raised her two children alone. Feruza is an entrepreneur who has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 10 years, raising sheep. Feruza began her business with two sheep and with the passing of the time she has developed her business. Feruza is going to increase working capital and from profit from her business to improve the living conditions for her children. Feruza is asking for a loan of 3,500 TJS to buy four sheep. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy four sheep for increasing working capital

loans.name: Hassan Babangida

texts.en: Hassan Babbangida is a 29-year-old farmer from Dankwaire. As a Babban Gona member, Hassan Babbangida is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Hassan Babbangida can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Hassan Babbangida is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Hassan Babbangida said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. In 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family. With this loan, Hassan Babbangida is on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural ingredients and to pay for labour to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is 40 years old, married and has two children ages 13 and 11, and both go to school. Sahar’s wife is a housewife. The family members are living in Baku region. Sahar has a store selling different types of seasonal fruits and vegetables. Sahar needs help to develop his business. He wants to buy more products for selling. For this reason he needs a loan in amount of 1,100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Sahar expresses great thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy more products for selling

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is widowed and the mother of five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school. She earns a living by buying and selling goods in the Philippines. Elizabeth requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 13 years, and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dry goods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is married and the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She earns a living by selling vegetables from a stall to town dwellers and neighbors. One of her biggest challenges is the high cost of transportation, but she dreams of establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. Annah will use this Kshs 20,000 loan to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Dalius

texts.en: Dalius is 32 years old and has applied for a loan of UGX.5,000,000 to buy beer and soda for his business. He is married with two children, ages 3 and 2, and one attends school. He has a wholesale mini depot, selling soda and beer, and his clients are businessmen who sell drinks retail  He is a very hard-working man who works 12 hours a day and six days a week.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He started his business in 2004 with the aim of increasing his income to sustain his family. His business is located in his local area of Ruhinda, Mitooma District. Dalius hopes to become financially stable in future. He is faced with the challenge of competition from other businessmen who trade in drinks. But he is determined to achieve his dreams through his hard work.

loans.use: To buy soda and beer for his business.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Sofia cooks food to sell at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: purchase to food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mirna

texts.es:
La señora Mirna  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a su  familia en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas y es muy conocida en su comunidad lo que hace que la demanda de su producto sea mucha.
Doña Mirna necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para seguir elaborando sus tortillas y contar con este ingreso el cual es muy importante para su hogar, espera que gracias esta inversión pueda contar con los insumos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
Doña Mirna espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras – Julio  2014
texts.en:
Mirna is a hard-working and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras. She makes and sells tortillas and she is very well-known in her neighborhood, which is why the demand for her product is so large.

Mirna needs the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime powder to continue making tortillas and to count on the income that is so important for her household. Grateful for the loan, she hopes it will allow her to have the necessary supplies to continue running her business and to cover her customers' requests. She hopes that the sales are greatly increased which will be reflected in her family's quality of life.

Mirna hopes that her business continues growing, making her the most well-known in the community, so that this way she is able to continue supporting her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime powder for her business.

loans.name: Candelaria Group

texts.es: Grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres proactivas y laboriosas, es coordinado por la señora Ileana de 66 años de edad y viuda, quien ha salido adelante después de la pérdida de su esposo, se dedica a la comercialización de sandias en el parque central de su comunidad, se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace cuatro años, tambien es costurera, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de sandias al por mayor. Las otras integrantes del grupo son la señora María Magdalena de 57 años de edad, comerciante de ropa en su comunidad y la señora Erlinda de 54 años de edad, quien se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos AVON en su comunidad desde hace dos años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group made up of three proactive and hard-working women is organized by Ileana. She is a 66-year-old widow who has moved forward after the loss of her husband. She makes a living selling watermelons in the central park in her community and has been in this business for four years. She also is a seamstress. The loan she is requesting is to buy watermelons wholesale. 

The other members of the group are Maria Magdalena who is a 57-year-old clothes saleswoman in her community and Erlinda who is 54 years old and has been making a living selling AVON cosmetics in her community for the past two years.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons wholesale.

loans.name: Luis Anibal

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del amor un lugar de clima cálido húmedo lleno de gente amable y trabajadora se encuentra ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de pichincha, este Cantón es muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, a disfrutar de sus maravillosas cascadas, sitios de descanso y su maravillosa flora y fauna silvestre 
En este Cantón vive y trabaja el señor Luis un hombre luchador de 28 años es padre soltero tiene una hija de 7 años a la que no puede ver mucho tiempo ya que ella vive en Loja, el nació y creció en el campo realizando todos los trabajos referentes, ahí aprendió todo sobre la agricultura y crianza de animales como ganado vacuno y ganado porcino, trabaja como auxiliar de ingeniería ambiental pero siempre le ha gustado y a deseado tener una granja de cerdos, solicita este crédito para emprender en una granja porcina. 
Con esta inversión mejoraran sus ingresos económicos y podrá ayudar más a su pequeña hija, el señor Luis agradece a Fundación Alternativa y Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a canton of love, a place with a warm, humid climate, full of kind and hardworking people which is located in the north west of the province. This canton is visited a lot by tourists, both local and from abroad, who come to enjoy its wonderful waterfalls, rest sites and marvellous native flora and fauna.  

In this canton you can find Luis, who lives and works there. Luis is a determined man of 28 years old who is a single father to a seven year old daughter who he can't see very often as she lives in Loja. 

Luis was born and raised in the country doing all sorts of jobs, which is where he learnt everything about agriculture and raising animals such as bovine and porcine livestock. He works as an assistant in environmental engineering but he has always liked and would like to have a pig farm. He is applying for this loan to start one up.

With this loan Luis will improve his income and will be able to help his young daughter more. Luis thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for their support and the opportunity they have given him.

loans.use: to start his own pig farm

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz is 27 years old, has a Master’s degree and is passionate about spreading literacy. That is why she has spent many years teaching at a school in her community. A year ago she started her own secondary school where she attempts to provide quality education to children who live nearby. She wants her school to change for the better and for the community to see this change. When she started running the school it had only 45 students, but now the number has increased to over 150. She uses the income from the school to help manage her household expenses. However, making investments in school infrastructure has left her with limited capital resources for making further improvements to the school. She wishes to buy whiteboards and other classroom supplies. For this reason, she has applied for a loan for 100,000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. This will allow her to continue fulfilling her dream of providing children with education and contributing more money to her household income.

loans.use: to buy whiteboards and other classroom supplies.

loans.name: Kassoum

texts.fr:
Monsieur KASSOUM est né vers 1956 à NIENA, marié, père de 5 enfants et il réside avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à SOCOURANI un quartier de NIENA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Monsieur KASSOUM mène des activités d’achat et de vente des herbicides, des engrais  il ya 20 ans, il s’approvisionne à SIKASSO.
Il est à son premier prêt  individuel commerçant avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. 
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 5 cartons de 12 bidons herbicides de qualité différente, 20 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais à SIKASSO pour la revendre au détail à NIENA à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.
 Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 97 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Kassoum was born circa 1956 in Niena, where he lives. He's married and the father of five children. He lives with his spouse in a traditional family in Socourani, a neighborhood in Niena, Sikasso Cercle, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mr. KASSOUM has been buying and selling herbicides and fertilizers for the past 20 years. He gets his supplies in Sikasso, and he is seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better meet an ever-increasing customer demand.

This loan will enable him to buy 5 boxes of 12 cans of herbicide of various quality and twenty 50 kg sacks of fertilizer. He buys in Sikasso, and retails in Niena, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

He foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 97'000, which will enable him to repay the loan and interest. The remainder will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy 60 cans of herbicide and 20 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Wang'ae Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a business mother who has been supporting her family by selling fish. She wakes up early in the morning, 5am, boarding a bus to the fish market where she buys stock. In about five hours, Rukia gets back home, starts to fry them and, thereafter, ready them for selling. She ends her business at 10:00pm daily and is able to make a fair return. 

She is in her early 50s, married, and together they have six children. One child is in school and the rest are grown. 

Rukia has joined Wang'ae Group to attain financial support and, hence, improve her business. She believes that, through Kiva's support, her family life will be better off. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first credit request, which she will use to buy fish inventory. She desires to sell more fish, so as to meet the customers' demands. 

Rukia will share this credit with her group, Wang'ae Group, which consists of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish inventory.

loans.name: Dina Lizeth

texts.es: Dina, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene 3 hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece a Siguatepeque, cerca de Taulabe. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos para damas y hace 3 años decidió cultivar café, esta finca la tiene en un terreno cerca a su casa. Y la producción la vende en el mercado local. Ella ha solicitado un préstamo por 7,000 Lempiras  para darle mantenimiento (limpieza y fertilizantes) a su finca de café y sacar mejor producción. Su meta a futuro es que sus hijos se gradúen y también dejarles un patrimonio para que tengan de que vivir.
texts.en:
Dina is 29 years old and is in a civil union with her partner with whom she was three children. She resides in a small town which is a part of Siguatepeque, close to Taulabe. Previously, she made a living selling women's cosmetics and three years ago decided to grow coffee. Her farm is on a piece of land close to her house and she sells the products at the local market. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 Lempiras to perform maintenance (cleaning and fertilizing) on her coffee farm and to yield better production. Her goal for the future is for their children to graduate and also to leave them an estate so they have something to live off of.

loans.use: to do cleaning maintenance and fertilize her coffee farm.

loans.name: Soumaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur SOUMAILA est né en fevrier 1979 à SIKASSO, marié et  père de 3 enfants, il réside avec ses épouses dans une famille traditionnelle à PANKAFOLASSO un village dans le cercle dans le  SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI.
Il collabore avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien son activité agricole pendant l’hivernage. 
Il est à son deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’Institution de Microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, le prêt précédant a été correctement remboursé.  
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs , ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 20 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 25 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir 5 hectares.
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau de village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 720 000 francs CFA par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son interêt, contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Soumaila was born in February 1979 in Sikasso, where he lives. He's married and the father of three children. He lives with his spouses in a traditional family in Pankafolasso, a village in Sikasso Cercle, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

He works withs Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out his farming activities during the rainy season. He's seeking his second loan to produce corn from the MFI. The previous loan was repaid without problem.

He grows corn, and this loan will enable him to buy twenty 50-kg sacks of fertilizers and 25 cans of herbicide of various quality, and to pay plowing cost to maintain 5 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in the village and in Sikasso, for cash and on credit, to a clientele comprising both men and women.

He intends to turn an average profit of XOF 720'000 per planting, which will enable him to repay the loan and interest, and contribute to covering the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of fertilizers and 25 cans of herbicide, and to pay plowing cost

loans.name: Maria Amparo

texts.es: Amparo de 51 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 6 hijos 3 mayores de edad y  3 hijos menores de 4, 11 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica  a la venta de verdura como: ayote y ejote, su esposo es agricultor y sus 3 hijos mayores aportan a la economía familiar. Amparo desea construir un patio con verga y piso de cemento en su vivienda ya que como se observa en la fotografía actualmente es de tierra por lo que pensando en la salud de su familia decidió pedir un crédito a FUSAI para comprar cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción de su patio con verga de cemento.
texts.en:
Amparo is 51 years old and lives with her husband and six children, three of whom are adults and three younger children who are 11, 7 and 4 years of age. Amparo is a hard working woman who sells vegetables such as pumpkin and green beans. Her husband is a farmer and her three elder children contribute to the household costs.

Amparo would like to build a patio with cement joists and floor in her home. As you can see from the photo, the current patio is just dirt. Thinking of the health of her family, Amparo decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron sheeting as well as paying for labourers to construct the patio with cement joists.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron sheeting as well as paying for labourers to construct a patio with cement joists.

loans.name: Flavio De Jesus

texts.es:
Flavio es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 35 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre.

Actualmente trabaja como técnico para una empresa de alimentos en el municipio de El Carmen de Viboral, adicionalmente posee cultivos de Hortensias, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo donde reside, esto le genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar y solventar las necesidades básicas de su esposa y 2 hijos.

Se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes), esto le permitirá seguir cuidado de sus Flores y mejorar la productividad de la próxima cosecha, lo que beneficiará los ingresos que percibe por cada venta, también comprara un saran para proteger sus cultivos de los rayos UV.

Flavio manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir luchando para generar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Flavio is a humble, hard-working farmer, 35 years old, who learned every kind of agricultural work when he was young.  His father taught him.

Today he works as a technician for a food company in the city of El Carmen de Viboral, and also owns hydrangea crops.   The flowers are picked and sold in the market place of the town where Flavio lives.  This provides enough resources for daily support at home and meeting the basic needs of his wife and two children.

He is seeking a loan to invest in buying agricultural products in bulk (manure, pesticides, fertilizers).  The purchase will let him continue to care for his flowers and improve their productivity, providing better income with each sale.  Flavio will also buy a protective plastic cover to guard the crops from UV rays.

Flavio says that his greatest desire is to keep fighting to create financial stability and give his family better conditions of life and well being.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and a protective plastic shield

loans.name: Emerson De Jesus

texts.es:
Emerson es una persona muy simpática y siempre tiene una sonrisa para los clientes que visitan su tienda de abarrotes.

Gracias a su carisma y buen humor se ha podido ganar el corazón y reconocimiento de las personas del sector.
Todos los días trabaja para darles una buena calidad de vida a sus padres quienes siempre lo apoyaron en todos sus proyectos.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar y de esta forma darle un impulso significativo a su actividad.

El guarda la esperanza de poder continuar con su negocio y así seguir impactando la vida de sus clientes a través de su buen servicio.
texts.en:
Emerson is a very nice person and he is always smiling at the customers that visit his grocery store. Thanks to his charm and good humor, he has managed to win the hearts and recognition of the people in the area. He works every day to give his parents a good life, since they always support his plans.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy an assortment of everyday household products to give him a significant push with his business. He hopes to be able to continue with his business and continue impacting the lives of his clients through his good service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his store.

loans.name: Nicolas Francisco

texts.es: Nicolás de 36 años de edad vive con su madre de 68 años de edad. Él es un  hombre emprendedor que viendo las grandes necesidades de su familia decidió buscar diferentes formas de ganarse la vida tales como: elaboración y venta de pan francés, también trabaja como jornalero, además aprendió el oficio de la carpintería el cual realiza cuando tiene algún tiempo. Nicolás desea mejorar su vivienda ya que esta no cuenta con puertas ni un techo además el piso esta deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines, 3 puertas, cemento, arena y grava para construir el techo y para encementar el piso de la vivienda, además deberá pagar mano de obra para la construcción.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 36 years old and lives with his mother who is 68. He is an enterprising man who, seeing the great needs of his family, decided to look for different ways to earn a living such as making and selling baguettes, working as a day labourer, and also learning the trade of carpentry which he does when he has free time. 

Nicolas would like to improve his home since his does not have doors or a roof and the floor has also deteriorated. For this reason he has requested a loan from FUSAI so he can buy galvanised metal sheeting, lumber, three doors, cement, sand and gravel to construct the roof and cement the floor of his home as well as paying for labourers to undertake the construction work.

loans.use: to buy doors, cement, sand, gravel, metal sheeting, wood, etc. to construct a roof and cement the floor of his home.

loans.name: Rabiu Kwairawa

texts.en: Rabiu kwairawa remembers feeling depressed  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, Rabiu kwairawa, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Rabiu kwairawa  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Rabiu kwairawa   With this loan, Rabiu kwairawa is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Herme Nery

texts.es:
El señor Herme un hombre luchador de 55 años el mantiene una sólida relación en unión tienen 7 hijos de los cuales todos son mayores de edad, la esposa no trabaja ella pasa en casa en una pequeña tienda que tienen, él trabaja en una finca del sector y tiene una granja de pollos, se iniciaron en estos negocios por iniciativa propia a los mismos le dedican un promedio de 10 horas por día, ellos viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos tuvieron que luchar duro para salir adelante y ayudar a que sus hijos se preparen y tengan un futuro mejor 
Vive y tiene el negocio en el Recinto San Juan de Puerto Quito un lugar muy tranquilo, de clima cálido húmedo y la gente es unida, amable y muy trabajadora, tradicionalmente todos los años realizan las fiestas del recinto
El señor Herme solicita el crédito para invertir en los negocios, arreglará los galpones y la tienda que tiene en casa, con esta nueva inversión mejoran sus ingresos económicos 
El señor Herme agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en:
Señor Herme, a determined man of 55 years, maintains a stable civil union relationship. They have 7 children, all of whom are adults. His wife doesn't work but spends time in the house in a small store that they have. He works on a farm in the area and has a chicken farm. They began both these business by their own initiative, and dedicate on average 10 hours a day to each.

They come from a humble family with few economic resources, and had to fight hard to get ahead and to help their children develop themselves and have a better future. 

They live and have their business in the zone of San Juan de Puerto Quito, a very calm place with a hot, humid climate. The people are united, friendly and very hardworking, traditionally every year they celebrate the holidays of the zone.

Señor Herme asks for this loan to invest in their businesses. He will fix the sheds and the store that they have in the house, and with this new investment they will improve their earnings. 

Señor Herme thanks Fundacion Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities they have given.

loans.use: to fix the sheds and a small store that they have in the house.

loans.name: Yokonia

texts.en:
Yokoknia, aged 45 years, is a known businessman at cell B, an Ishaka municipality. Owning a retail shop since 2008, he has managed to sustain his family of two children and a sibling by adequately providing for their needs. He is married, and his wife is a secondary teacher who contributes to the family’s income. He is also a farmer majoring in banana farming. His two children (twins), aged 3 months old, are not yet in school. 

He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 (five million shillings only) to mulch his banana plantation. He is an honest man in his business and works for ten hours a day. His clients are people around Bushenyi district. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital to operate his business but hopes to overcome it after acquiring a loan, which will help him boost his business. 

He hopes to complete the construction of his house and modernize his agriculture, and in the long run, increase his harvests of matooke for his family and sustain their daily activities.

loans.use: to buy mulch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her business

loans.name: Saratu Ibrahim

texts.en: Saratu Ibrahim is a 35-year-old farmer from Maimai. As a Babban Gona member, Saratu Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets, and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Saratu Ibrahim can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Saratu Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap 40 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Saratu Ibrahim said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Samaila, Patience, and Mercy, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”. With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Safayanu

texts.en: Safayanu is a Babban Gona farmer. Safayanu is driven by one goal; to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” It is this ambition that led Safayanu to join Babban Gona. Now, as a Babban Gona member, he finally has the opportunity to access credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Safayanu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare; double the national average of 14. However, Safayanu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap at least 45 bags per hectare this season because with this loan, he will finally be able to access required yield enhancing inputs, such as improved seeds. Safayanu is hoping that as a result of this expected yield, he will finally have enough money to make significant life changes. When asked what changes he would like to make, he said “I plan to use the money I make to expand my farmland. With this loan, Safayanu will be able to access all the inputs and services to make this dream a reality.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a hard working woman. Mariam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past year, Mariam has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which renders food services. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to expand to a clothing business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Dableniton Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe  DABLENITON  sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur sixième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur MOUSSA N débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme  DABLENITON.
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 14 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  3,5 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  520 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Dableniton are married men who, on average, are 48 years old and have eight children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their sixth loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Moussa N, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy 14 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer, 20 drums of different herbicides, and to pay the cost of plowing 3.5 hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Moussa N hopes to earn an average 520,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow him to pay back his part of the loan and its interest and to support his family's everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Djekafo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame MARIAM assises à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  DJEKAFO 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekafo 1 group are married women who, on average, are 38 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their tenth loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly. 

Mariam, who is seated first on the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer, one drum of herbicide, and to pay the cost of plowing a 1/2 hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Mariam hopes to earn an average 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband take care of their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years and married. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with four children. Regina is a tailor, a business she has done for the last one year, earning a monthly income of KES 2,000.

Regina is requesting her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase textiles in order to improve her business.

With the anticipated profits, Regina will be able to expand her business further. Her future hope and dream is to open up a hotel.

loans.use: to purchase textile

loans.name: Juana Benancia

texts.es:
Juana tiene 19 años de edad vive en el cantón San Miguel Provincia de Bolivar su estado civil es casada vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos. 
Es integrante de la ventanilla rural Ambrocio Laso.
Juana se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de papa y habas, también a la crianza de pollo y chanchos utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de animales para criarles y venderles, gracias a este podra incrementar su negocio ella realiza las compras  de los alimentos para los animales en Chimbo.
los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia, en su tiempo libre se dedica al deporte y a ver la television.
texts.en:
Juana is 19 years old and lives in San Miguel canton in the province of Bolivar. She is married and  lives with her husband and two children. She is a member of the rural community bank Ambrocio Laso.

Juana is engaged in farming and planting of potatoes and beans, also raising poultry and pigs. She will use the loan money to buy animals to raise and sell. Thanks to this, she will be able to increase her business. She buys food for the animals in Chimbo.

The challenge she faces is competition. In her spare time she plays sport and watches TV.

loans.use: to buy animals

loans.name: Lozi

texts.en:
Lozi operates a stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her to grow her business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Hana Al- Omeri Group

texts.en:
Hana Al- Omeri is a group that comprises four members, women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Hafsa is the leader of the group. She is a 31-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is six years old, and the youngest one is four years old. They live in a rented house. She studied until the elementary school, but she couldn't complete her study. Hafsa's husband works as a builder, but most days, he can't find work to look after the family. Due to his unfixed income source, his family passes with an economical crisis most days. 

So, Hafsa wants to help her husband in the expenses of her family, and she wants to improve the living standards of the family. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to supply her house with the necessary needs and to prepare delicious food for the family inside the house.

Hafsa looks forward to building their own house on the land she and her husband purchased to save the money that they pay for renting.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to supply her house with the necessary needs and to prepare delicious food for the family inside the house.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en: Aminu is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Aminu joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Yunusa, Abdulraul and  Usman. Aminu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Aminu will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Aminu can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Aminu said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Aminu is not thinking about just this year; he said, In 5 years, he  wants to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Inusa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children; Salisu, Nura and Usama. Inusa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Inusa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Inusa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Inusa said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Inusa is not thinking about just this year; he said, In 5 years, he  wants to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 45-year-old farmer from Maimai.  As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Ibrahim can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Ibrahim is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Ibrahim said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Saminu, Silamis, and Nasara, and in 5 years, "I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs”. With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 50-year-old married mother of one, who decided in September 2012 to start her own special traditional saj bread business from her house to support her husband in increasing their family's income and covering their living expenses.

Nada bakes the special saj bread, which is well known in almost all of the Lebanese villages and highly requested.

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a special upgraded dough mixer necessary for her business development. She will also develop her workplace by buying a wall closet (special kitchen closet), where she can store all of her needs in a well managed way. She will also put an iron door to her bakery for safety reasons and will paste wall and floor tiles at her workplace for a better image. All of these changes combined together will surely develop Nada's business. 

She hopes that one day she can develop her business widely to reach a level that she has to open a separate bakery far from her house.

loans.use: To buy a special upgraded dough mixer

loans.name: Sababoumadogo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe SABABOUMADOGO 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à M'PEDOUGOU un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame ABY débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABABOUMADOGO 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Sababoumadogo 1 group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in M'pedougou, in Farakala, a part of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their ninth loan, and their previous loans have been repaid correctly.

Aby, who is standing second from the left in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing a half hectare of land. 

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit. 

Aby hopes to earn an average 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. Earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and its interest and help her husband take care of their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Djekafo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe  DJEKAFO 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à  LOBOUGOULA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame FATOUMATA assises à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  DJEKAFO 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.

They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Fatoumata, who is seated first on the right in the photo, grows rice. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kilogram sacs of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide and to pay the cost of plowing a half hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Fatoumata hopes to earn an average 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband take care of their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay the cost of plowing

loans.name: Jajang

texts.en: Jajang is a hardworking man who runs a small stall called 'warung' that sells snacks, drinks, consumer goods and mobile airtime credits. Jajang and his wife have a child and together they live in West Bandung, one of regencies in West Java. To meet his family's needs, Jajang is expanding his business by selling mobile airtime credits and servicing bill payments. He began working with Ruma about a month ago and he is so excited about it because not only he is able to increase his income, but he can gain more friends from the Ruma agents' networks and learn more about mobile technology. As the business continues to run, he needs a working capital loan from Kiva to process more airtime transactions for his customers on the weekends. The loan he obtains will be very useful to support his business continuity.

loans.use: To process more mobile airtime credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Marco Aurelio

texts.es:
Gracias a la perseverancia y coraje de Marco es que ahora su hogar podrá tener unos ingresos extra.

El prepara y vende comidas rápidas en el municipio de Bello, actividad que emprendió con el afán de buscar nuevos ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Su esposa e hijos son la mayor motivación que tiene para trabajar diariamente y esforzarse para ser cada día mejor.
El espera poder impulsar su negocio con la compra de un congelador, insumos y materia prima.
Con estos elementos él podrá tener sus alimentos y otros insumos en perfecto estado para sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener un restaurante en la misma zona para no perder a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks to Marco's perseverance and courage, his home will now be able to have some extra income. 

He prepares and sells fast food meals in the municipality of Bello, an activity that he undertook in an effort to find new revenue in order to support his family. 

His wife and children are the biggest motivation he has to work daily and to strive to be better every day. 

He hopes to be able to boost his business with the purchase of a freezer, ingredients, and resources. 

With these items he will be able to have his foods and other ingredients in a perfect state for his customers. His big dream is to be able to have a restaurant in the same area so that he doesn't lose his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer and ingredients for work.

loans.name: Sababoumadogo 2 Group

texts.fr:
