Karidia hopes to earn an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and its interest and help her husband take care of their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Paz Y Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
ALICIA, tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene hijos pequeños. Ellos son su motivo y motor para crecer e independizarse económicamente.
Alicia forma parte del grupo "Paz y Desarrollo" junto con cinco socias mas, éste grupo ha tenido en algún momento problemas, pero han sabido salir adelante apoyándose entre ellas, actualmente son un grupo puntual y responsable.
Desde hace mas de cuatro años ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por medio de catálogos, ofrece a sus familiares y amigos mas cercanos logrando aumentar su clientela y poder mantener un ngocio independiente.
El préstamo recibido lo invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para poder tener un stock disponible para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Alicia, 36, is married and has small children. They are her motivation and drive to grow and become economically independent.

Alicia is part of the "Paz y Desarrollo" along with five other members.  This group has had some problems in the past, but they have known how to get ahead by supporting each other. Currently, they are a punctual and responsible group. 

For over four years, she has worked selling beauty products from catalogs. She offers them to her family members and close friends, managing to increase her customer base and be able to maintain an independent business. 

The received loan will be invested in the purchase of beauty products to be able to have stock available and serve her customers.

loans.use: to invest it in the purchase of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
From Batheay district, Kampong Cham province, Khy, 35, is an experienced and industrious farmer. He is a lovely father of one child who is enrolling in the primary school. By operating a farming business on a small rice field, he can earn around USD 4 a day to support his family's daily needs. So far, Khy has been involved in this career for 15 years.

To accelerate his farming process, Khy would like to get cows to help him for plowing the farm land, yet he can’t afford them. Due to the shortage of money, he would like to get a Kiva loan via HKL, since it has a low interest rate.  

He also thanks all the lenders for their generous behavior.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Sababoumadogo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABABOUMADOGO 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 49 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à M'PEDOUGOU un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

Satou hopes to earn an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her part of the loan and its interest and to help her husband take care of their family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Creciendo Juntos Group

texts.es: Walter es un joven de 28 años de edad, casado y pertenece al grupo Creciendo Juntos, se dedica a hacer movilidad de personas en su auto  de lunes a sábado, le gusta su trabajo porque tiene horarios adecuados que le permiten también hacer otro tipo de servicio, solicito el préstamo para hacer el mantenimiento en la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y se siente agradecido con los inversionistas de KIVA  por la ayuda que le brindan. Envía saludos, bendiciones y agradece la confianza. Walter se encuentra sentado al centro de la fotografía, en la foto adjunta se puede observar a la Sra. María Elena.
texts.en:
Walter is twenty-eight years old, married, and belongs to the group Creciendo Juntos [Growing Together].  He makes a living providing transport to people in his car, from Monday to Saturday.  He likes his job because his work schedule permits him to work in other types of service.  

He requested the loan for maintenance and the purchase of parts for his vehicle.  He feels grateful to Kiva investors for the help they provide.  He sends greetings, blessings, and thanks for the trust. Walter is pictured at the center of the photo, and the attached photo is of group member Maria Elena who was unavailable when the first photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy parts and to maintain his vehicle

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia Roxana se sigue dedicando al trabajo en una empresa privada,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiena varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien.La socia solicita le credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Roxana continues to work at her job at a private company.  She works from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  Roxana has been at this company for several years. Roxana is requesting a loan in order to buy sound equipment for her home.  She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment for her home.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso De Andahuaylillas Group

texts.en:
These members belong to the “NUEVO PROGRESO DE ANDAHUAYLILLAS” communal bank which is located in Cusco District in the Province and Department of the same name. 

Norma is one of the members. She is 42 years old single and has 3 children. She works in her business which is a grocery store. She sells basic food items like rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8 am until 10 pm. The member has 5 years of running this business and things are going well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. Norma is requesting a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice. 

The members who have had their photo attached to the group photo had their photos taken later as they couldn't attend the meeting due to their work. The other members work in businesses like selling handicrafts, selling animals, a grocery store and a restaurant. Norma thanks those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments within the establish time.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Carmen works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Carmen is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing/fish vending business.

Carmen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears for her business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Regina is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Regina has been raising pigs for 15 years, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luis Klever

texts.es:
Luis tiene 26 años de edad vive en el cantón Sn Miguel Provincia de Bolivar su estado civil es soltero vive con sus padres. Es integrante de la ventanilla rural Ambrocio Laso que se dedican a las labores agricolas.


Luis se dedica a la agricultura y siembra de papas habas y cevolla, también a la crianza de pollos y chanchos  utilizara el dinero del crédito para la compra de animales para engorde y luego venderlos gracias al credito podra incrementar el negocio, las compras realiza en Chimbo.
Sueño es mejorar en el negocio, los desafíos a los que enfrenta es la competencia en su tiempo libre se dedica al deporte a jugar boli e indor.
texts.en:
Luis is 26 years old and lives in the canton of San Miguel in the province of Bolivar. He is single and lives with his parents. He is a member of the rural solidarity group Ambrocio Laso which is dedicated to agricultural work. 

Luis works in agriculture, sowing potatoes, beans and onions as well as raising chickens and pigs. He will use the money from this loan to buy animals to fatten up and then resell. Thanks to this loan he will be able to expand his business and make his purchases in Chimbo.

Luis's dream is to improve his business. The challenge he faces is the competition. In his free time Luis likes to play indoor volleyball.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten up

loans.name: Andrea Catalina

texts.es:
Andrea:
Andrea tiene 23 años y nació en Barranquilla, Atlántico, población ubicada en el norte de Colombia. Es la hija menor de su familia, su hermana mayor es Ingeniera Electrónica y su madre es ama de casa. A pesar de las dificultades económicas que tuvieron, Andrea consiguió estudiar Ingeniería Química en la Universidad del Atlántico, donde estuvo becada todos los semestres y logró obtener el título profesional en Noviembre del 2012. 
Andrea tiene como principal objetivo realizar una maestría en Protección Ambiental y Producción de Alimentos Agrícolas en la Universidad de Hohenheim en Alemania, y para lograrlo necesita solicitar el apoyo de Kiva, puesto que es la única forma para poder cubrir los gastos de exámenes de idioma y aplicación a las universidades. Una vez realice su maestría y regrese a Colombia, Andrea anhela trabajar en fundaciones u organizaciones sociales que lleven a cabo proyectos que incluyan la recuperación de suelos, agricultura ecológica y seguridad alimentaria, y que al mismo tiempo contribuya con la auto-sostenibilidad de su región.
Aquí está su historia: 
Desde siempre, mi familia me ha dado su apoyo incondicional en todos los proyectos que he llevado a cabo. Aunque planeo embarcarme una aventura de aprendizaje extraordinaria, mi madre y mi hermana no cuentan con el apoyo financiero necesario para hacer este sueño realidad.
Formular fungicidas fue durante dos años una parte importante de mi vida profesional como ingeniera química. Pero llegó un momento en que me di cuenta que así no me veía durante los años que le esperan a mi carrera. Lo que solía formular en dichas plantas químicas, en definitiva, no es una solución sostenible en la práctica de la agricultura en términos tanto de su rendimiento, así como de la protección ambiental. Es por eso que decidí dejar esa industria y enfocar tanto mi carrera como mi vida a la protección ambiental y a la agricultura ecológica. 
Comencé a tocar puertas a distintas organizaciones ambientales, pero he recibido respuestas negativas por distintas razones. Sin embargo, eso no me ha detenido en la lucha de mi sueño. Así que actualmente me encuentro haciendo un diplomado en la Universidad Nacional sobre Agricultura ecológica y Biología de suelos y al mismo tiempo, soy parte de un grupo de voluntariado en Agricultura Urbana, que se centra en ayudar a poblaciones vulnerables en las áreas circundantes a Bogotá.
Con las visitas de campo que he tenido la fortuna de realizar hasta el momento, he podido interactuar de primera mano con los campesinos en la Sabana de Bogotá; lo cual me ha llevado a poder asimilar lo dispendioso que puede llegar a ser, en cuanto a tiempo, recursos y dinero, el llevar a cabo prácticas ecológicas en el campo, teniendo en cuenta que mucha de esta tierra ha sufrido muchos años de agricultura convencional y por lo tanto, tiene niveles de degradación altos. 
Por estar razones he decidido estudiar en el exterior una Maestría en Protección Ambiental y Producción de alimentos agrícolas. Al cursarla quiero poder desarrollar, aún más, mi potencial en un ambiente educativo de primer mundo, de la mano de expertos en las prácticas ecológicas y sostenibles en la agricultura. Además de poder absorber experiencias de colegas de todos los ámbitos y culturas para que el proceso de aprendizaje involucre una sinergia que faculte soluciones interdisciplinarias fácilmente adaptables a nuestro medio colombiano. 
Solicito el apoyo por parte de KIVA para completar los requisitos de idioma y de papeleo para la inscripción de la Maestría mencionada con antelación, debido a que muy a pesar de no contar con todos los recursos monetarios en el momento para llevarlo a cabo, poseo la pasión y la suficiente motivación para creer en este sueño que llevo construyendo, porque no sólo se trata de mí, como persona, sino de cada uno de los campesinos que se trabajan Sol a Sol sin descanso para labrar la tierra y poder cultivar el alimento no sólo para ellos y los miembros de su familia sino para todos los que nos alimentamos de la tierra indirectamente.
texts.en:
Andrea is 23 years old and was born in Barranquilla, Atlantico, a town located in the north of Colombia. She is the youngest daughter in her family. Her older sister is an Electronics Engineer and her mother is a homemaker. Despite the economic difficulties they had, Andrea managed to study Chemical Engineering at the Univeristy of Atlantico, where she received a scholarship every semester and managed to obtain a professional qualification in November of 2012. 

Andrea's main objective is to pursue a Masters degree in Environmental Protection and Agricultural Food Production at the University of Hohenheim in Germany. In order to do so, she needs to request Kiva's help, given that it is the only way she will be able to cover the expenses of the language exams and university application.  Once she has completed her Masters and returned to Colombia, Andrea hopes to work for foundations or social organizations that carry out projects which include soil recovery, ecological agriculture and food security, and that at the same time contribute to the self-sustainability of her region.

Here is her story:

"My family has always given me their unconditional support in all of the projects that I have accomplished. Although I plan to embark on an adventure of extraordinary learning, my mother and my sister do not have the financial support necessary to make this dream a reality. For two years, creating fungicides was an important part of my professional life as a chemical engineer. But at a certain point I realized that this was not how I envisioned myself in the years of my career that awaited me. What I used to create in those chemical plants, in the end, is not a sustainable solution in agricultural practice, both in terms of performance as well as environmental protection. That is why I decided to leave that industry and focus my career, like my life, on environmental protection and ecological agriculture.

I began to knock on the doors of various environmental organizations, but I received negative responses for different reasons. However, that did not hold me back in the fight to achieve my dream. And so, I am currently studying for a diploma from the National University in Ecological Agriculture and Soil Biology. At the same time, I am part of a volunteer group in Urban Agriculture, which focusses on helping vulnerable people in the areas surrounding Bogota.

With the field visits I have had the fortune to experience up to this moment, I have been able to interact firsthand with the rural workers in the Savanna of Bogota. That interaction has allowed me to absorb how arduous it can become, in terms of time, resources and money, to carry out ecological practices in the countryside, keeping in mind that much of this land has suffered many years of conventional agriculture and as a result has high levels of degradation.

For these reasons, I decided to study abroad for a Masters in Environmental Protection and Agricultural Food Production. By enrolling in this program, I hope to develop, even further, my potential, in a first world educational environment, at the hands of experts in ecological and sustainable agricultural practices. I will also be able to absorb the experiences of colleagues from all cultures and settings so that the learning process will involve a synergy that foments interdisciplinary solutions easily adaptable to our Colombian environment.

I am requesting Kiva's support in order to complete the language and paperwork requirements to register for the aforementioned Masters, given that very much despite lacking the monetary resources at the moment to carry it out, I have the passion and sufficient motivation to believe in this dream that I am building. This is because it is not only about myself, as a person, but rather about each of the farmers that work from sun up to sun down without rest to work the land in order to be able to cultivate the food, not only for themselves and the members of their families, but for all of us who nourish ourselves indirectly from the land."

loans.use: to pay for the application process to the University of Hohenheim in Germany.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita works hard to support her family. Lucita is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lucita has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Lucita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Norma has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice

loans.name: Marco Emilio

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos más conocido como Cantón del amor lleno de gente amable y trabajadora, es un lugar muy turístico, por las diversas cascadas y hosterías y el maravilloso clima, aquí encontramos la cascada del amor al cual se puede llegar muy rápido por el maravilloso teleférico que tienen en este Cantón, aquí vive y trabaja el señor Marco un hombre luchador de 55 años mantiene una sólida relación en unión libre de la cual tienen 8 hijos de ellos 2 son independientes y 6 viven en casa, la esposa trabaja como empleada doméstica. 
El trabaja como agricultor en una finca del sector, solicita el crédito para invertir en un negocio, emprenderá en una granja de cerdos, de esta actividad aprendió en su niñez junto con los papás, y también en fincas en las que ha trabajado, el viene de una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos lo que le impidió prepararse solo tiene la primaria, hoy lucha muy duro para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro que él. 
Con esta inversión mejorarán su calidad de vida y podrán salir adelante, el señor Marco agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas.
texts.en: San Miguel de los Bancos, better known as Cantón del Amor, is full of friendly, hard-working people. It is a touristy place because of the various waterfalls, inns, and marvelous climate. Here we find the waterfall La Cascada del Amor to which you can arrive very quickly on the wonderful cable car. Marco lives and works here. He is a determined man of 55 years who maintains a strong marriage from which he has 8 children; two of whom are independent, six live at home. His wife works as a maid. He works on a farm in the sector. He requests a loan to invest in a business he is starting, pig farming. He learned this work from childhood from his parents and also from farms where he has worked. He comes from a humble family with limited economic resources. What impedes him from readying himself is that he only has a primary school education. Today, he fights very hard so that his children have a better future than he did. With this investment, they will improve their quality of life and move forward. Marco thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities afforded.

loans.use: to start his business, a pig farm.

loans.name: Yohana

texts.en: Yohana remembers not being able to repair his home during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Yohana, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Yohana is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Yohana. With this loan, Yohana is well on his way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Kaka Yohana

texts.en: Kaka Yohana remembers not being able to repair her home.  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Kaka Yohana, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Kaka Yohana is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty” expressed Kaka Yohana. With this loan, Kaka Yohana is well on her way to achieving  this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Beaula

texts.en:
Beaula runs a gardening business based in the Wedza District of Zimbabwe. For the past two years, she has been growing and selling a wide range and steady supply of fresh produce during the local growing season. 

Beaula plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer to increase production on her land. Her hope is to expand the business and become a major provider of vegetables. This will enable her to not only provide for her family’s basic needs, but also to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, chemicals, and fertilizer to increase production on her land.

loans.name: Musa Yohana

texts.en: Musa Yohana remembers not being able to feed his family  during a particularly bad harvest. This was before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now,  Musa Yohana, like all Babban Gona members,  can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Musa Yohana  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  “In 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs” expressed Musa Yohana.With this loan, Musa Yohana is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tasiaelua

texts.en:
Tasiaelua is a 23-year-old single woman. Her business helps her family meet their financial obligations and provide for their weekly, essential needs. 

In her business, Tasiaelua sells peanuts she has harvested from her peanut farm to members of her community and to the general public. She plans to use this loan to purchase pitchforks, peanut seeds, fertilisers, chemicals, and a mistblower. The loan will also help Tasiaelua to continue to expand and improve her peanut farm, as well as pay laborers. Tasiaelua hopes to continue to maintain the successful sale of her peanuts and would save a lot of her profits for emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase pitchforks, peanut seeds, fertilisers, chemicals, and a mistblower

loans.name: Maripositas De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARIPOCITAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosomery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de colchas, venta de condimentos, venta de CD’s, taller de costura, servicio de internet, venta de ají, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  costura de colchas; da a conocer que este negocio lo implemento hace doce años, iniciando con el primer préstamo que obtuvo de Pro Mujer, menciona que aprendió la costura de estos productos solamente al observar su elaboración. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela y fibra por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Maripocitas de Collpani” (Butterflies of Collpani) is starting its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Rosmery is the president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as managing a neighborhood store, selling quilts, selling condiments, selling CDs, operating a sewing workshop, providing Internet services, selling aji peppers, and selling food.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Rosmery.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a client of the organization.  Rosmery currently has a sewing business in which she produces quilts.  She has become knowledgeable about this business since she started 12 years ago.  Rosmery launched her business with the first loan she obtained from Pro Mujer.  She also mentions that she learned how to manufacture these products by observing how they were made.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric and fibers in bulk.  She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of Alto and then uses them to make the products she sells based on the orders from her customers.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Rosmery is single and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosmery said that she enjoys the training seminars and the health services offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy fabric and fibers in bulk.

loans.name: Chañucagua Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHAÑUCAGUA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Cristina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, tienda de barrio, venta de arena, tejido de mantas, venta de charque (carne seca), venta de comida, elaboración de gomitas y golosinas.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Cristina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de ganadería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, ya que desde niño ella apoyo a su familia y por ello conocía este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo a la crianza lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Chañucagua” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Community Center.  This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors that is headed by Sra. Cristina as its president.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as managing a bookstore, managing a neighborhood store, selling sand, weaving blankets, selling dried meat, selling foods, and making gumdrops and candies.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Cristina.  She says that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house.  Cristina currently has a cattle business that she started through her own initiative.  As a child, she helped her family and was able to gain knowledge about this type of work.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying cattle, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in her community.  She will raise the animals before selling them from her vending post.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family.  Cristina is married and has six children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Cristina said that she enjoys the training seminars that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Pacha Yllari De Huandar Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PACHA YLLARI DE HUANDAR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Huandar, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Roxana ella es soltera y tiene 33 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
Al momento de tomar la foto el socio se agacho.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of this group belong to the comunal bank “PACHA YLLARI DE HUANDAR”. This bank is located in the district of Huandar, in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

One member is Roxana, she is single, 33 years of age and has two children. She works in her own business selling and raising animals, she raises guinea pigs and hens, she grows and fattens them and then sells them in different markets.

Through this small business she is able to provide well for her children, her dream is to have a shop from which she can sell the guinea pigs and hens. She is asking for a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens as well as food for them.

The other members of the group work selling fruits, selling animals, running a grocery store, and running a restaurant. 

Roxana is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this medium, and promises to make her repayments within the set time period.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens as well as food for them.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El socio Edmundo se dedica al trabajo como odontologo,el socio tiene su consultorio donde atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar su consultorio de odontologia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar instrumentos de odontologia.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edmundo is a dentist. He has his practice, where he receives patients from 8:00am until 6 pm. He has been in this business for several years now, and he is doing very well. His dream is to grow his dentistry practice.

He requests the loan to purchase dentistry instruments. He is happy with the loan, and he promises to meet his payments.

loans.use: to purchase dentistry instruments.

loans.name: Sababoumadogo 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe SABABOUMADOGO 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à M'PEDOUGOU un village dans la commune de FARAKALA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame ZIRE assises au milieu sur  la photo dans ce groupe de femme SABABOUMADOGO 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 2 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The seven members of the SABABOUMADOGO 4 group are married women, who are on average 37 years old, have 3 children, and live for the most part in traditional families in M'PEDOUGOU, a village in the FARAKALA commune in the SIKASSO circle, the 3rd administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their 9th loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The crop grown is rice with Mrs. ZIRE, sitting in the middle of the photo in this women’s group SABABOUMADOGO 4. With her loan, she plans to buy two 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 1 container of herbicide and to pay for labor to maintain 0.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. She foresees earning a monthly profit of 74,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan with interest and to help her husband with the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El socio Luis Alberto se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura, el socio tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa,cebada y trigo, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de agricultura. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto keeps on engaging in agriculture. He grows potatoes, barley and wheat in a field that he owns. He works from 8 am to 6 pm. He has been engaging in this activity for many years and things are going very well. His dream is to expand his activity. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. 

He is happy about the loan and he commits to complying with the repayments of his dues.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Inusa

texts.en: Inusa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Inusa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  family. Inusa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Inusa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Inusa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Inusa is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Biviana Stella

texts.es:
Biviana es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 31 años de edad, es casada y con muchos deseos de formar una familia.

Desde hace algunos años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja sola todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina remachadora, sublimadora, plancha industrial y mesa de corte.

Con estos elementos podrá reforzar en gran medida el trabajo que ya viene realizando y podrá sacar adelante su trabajo gracias a esta ayuda.

Biviana manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Biviana is a vigorous, obliging and hardworking woman. She is 31 years old, married, and very much wants to have a family. 

Some years ago, she began working in the area of making clothing, providing clothing services to third parties and to customers directly. She learned the craft through experience, and works alone every day, in this way generating sufficient resources to support her husband with the economic burden of the home. 

Currently, she is motivated to ask for this loan to purchase a riveting machine, a sublimation machine, an industrial iron, and a cutting table. 

With these items she will be able to greatly enhance the work already being done, and she will be able to get ahead in her job thanks to this help.

Biviana shows that she intends to continue putting a lot of effort into her work, thus she wants to expand her business and be able to generate opportunities for jobs, also guaranteeing economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase machines for making clothing.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 46 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for one year.

In the future Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Idi

texts.en: Idi is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Idi joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Aminu, Abubakar, and  Kadija. Idi is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Idi will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Idi can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, his said, “I plan to use the money  to build a better home.” Idi is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

loans.name: Tonwassa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe TONWASSA 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et ont en moyenne 8 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à ZOUMANA DIASSA un village dans la commune de KLELA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils  collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de maïs  avec monsieur  DIAKALIA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme TONWASSA 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 10 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente, payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir  2,5 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  390 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son interet et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: The ten members of the TONWASSA 2 group are married men, who are on average 39 years old, have 8 children, and live for the most part in traditional families in ZOUMANA DIASSA, a village in the KLELA commune in the SIKASSO circle, the 3rd administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The crop grown is corn with Mr. DIAKALIA, standing in the center of the photo in this men’s group TONWASSA 2. With his loan, he plans to buy ten 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 15 containers of herbicides of differing quality and to pay for labor to maintain 2.5 hectares. After the harvest, the produce is sold in the village in SIKASSO to a clientele composed of men and women for cash or credit. He foresees earning a monthly profit of 390,000 francs CFA per season. This profit will allow him to repay his loan with interest and to contribute to the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a repeat customer and a widow who is 39 years old. She deals in cattle trading as her business and her customers are cattle traders. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 (three million shillings) to buy diary cows for milk production. She is a hardworking woman who works 12 hours a day and 6 days a week. The business is carried out from her local area. She is, however, faced with the challenge of competition from other cattle farmers and traders but is determined to succeed due to her hard work. She is grateful for the work of the Kiva lenders and hopes to maintain the partnership through good repayments.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a 50-year-old farmer.  As a Babban Gona member, Isah is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Isah can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isah is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to educate my children; Nadiya, Amana, and  Mansura. My overall goal is to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving these goals.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Emmanuel joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children. Emmanuel is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Emmanuel will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would  be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive, but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Emmanuel can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Emmanuel said “I plan to use the money I make this year to expand my farmland”. Emmanuel is not thinking about just this year; he said, In 5 years, he wants to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI 2 est constitué de 9 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39  ans et 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARABA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 7ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée de SOUNKOURA, la 3ème femme assise dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des semences, payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour exploiter 1 hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en: The BENKADI 2 group is made up of nine married women, who are on average 39 years old, have 5 children, and live in polygamous families in FARABA, a village in BOUGOUNI, the 3rd administrative region of MALI. They are collaborating with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to improve their agricultural businesses during the rainy season. They are on their seventh loan with the institution, and their previous loans were properly repaid. The crop grown is peanuts with SOUNKOURA, sitting third from the right in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy fertilizer and pay for the labor and hoeing to farm 1 hectare. The produce will be sold in the village at the market after harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. She foresees earning a monthly profit of 60,000 FCFA per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband with the household's daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor and hoeing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicines and pay for medical consultation.

loans.name: Sopio

texts.en:
Sopio is 41 years old and a widow from Rustavi city. She has only one son and takes care of him by herself. Sopio works as a sales lady in a clothing store and generates 400 GEL per month. In order, somehow, to increase her income, Sopio decided to start her own business, parallel to her current activity. She requested a loan to purchase stock of perfumes and start trading among her clients and neighbors. Sopio will sell the perfumes from the store and also from her house.
 
Her loan request was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, which enables people to start their own businesses. With the help of this loan, Sopio will be able to more effectively meet her daily expenses, make a better lifestyle for her son and give him a good education. 

Sopio will be really grateful for assistance and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To start trading with perfumes

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: Verónica de 32 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos 15, 11, 8 y 3 años de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que gracias a su visión para los negocios ha logrado mantener su venta de verduras desde hace 10 años, además su esposo aporta a la economía familiar. Verónica desea colocar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda ya que este se encuentra un poco deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar ladrillo de piso,cemento y arena, además deberá pagar mano de obra para que le coloquen ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Veronica, 32, lives with her husband and their 4 children aged 15, 11, 8 and 3.  She is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her aptitude for business, has managed to keep her business selling vegetables running for 10 years.  Her husband also contributes to the family's finances.  

Veronica wants to put a brick floor in her home, because the one she has is a bit run down. This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy brick flooring material, cement, and sand and to pay for the labor to install the brick floor in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials to put in a brick floor and to pay for labor to install it

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 56-year-old hardworking widow who supports a family of four children and has been a farmer for 20 years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Agnes is now servicing her third loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use this entire amount to buy additional seeds and fertilizers for her farm produce.  

Agnes plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to start a dairy farming business on her homestead and become more successful with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her farm produce and plantation.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Musa joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Dinatu,Benedik, and Amon. Musa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Musa will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products such as sand. With access to high quality inputs, Musa can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14 and  earn up to $2000/ha: more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked how he plans to spend the income he will make this year  as a Babban Gona member, he said, “I plan to use the money  to expand my farmland.” Musa is not thinking about this year alone; he expressed that his longterm goal is to “become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this goal.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield.

texts.en: Ahmed is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ahmed joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his  children: Zakariya, Mathew, and Bilkisu. loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicines and for medical consultations

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochelle is 19 years old and single. She is now in her fourth year of college taking a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology (BSIT) at Nueva Vizcaya State University. She aims to finish her education so that she can find a good job someday and help her parents to improve their poor living status. However, due to financial hardship, her parents cannot afford to finance all her necessities for school. For this reason, she would like to seek educational assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI of PHP 10,000 to fully pay her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees in school. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees in school

location.town: Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya
