loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Avelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, etc. for her fishing business.

Avelina has been in this business for 24 years now.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net for her fishing business

loans.name: Merasol

texts.en:
Merasol is 34 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Merasol is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merasol has been farming rice for four years and earns additional income from her buy and sell of rice business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en: Ayuba is a maize farmer and member of Babban Gona. Ayuba joined Babban Gona primarily to create a better future for his children Matthew, Rhuda, and Tabita. Ayuba is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty. For the first time, Ayuba will have access to quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed. Without this loan, he would be subjected to buying these products in the open market where the products are not only very expensive but are often diluted with external products like sand. With access to high quality inputs, Ayuba can reap up to 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14  and  earn up to $2000/ha, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income.  When asked, Ayuba said “I plan to use the money I make this year to provide more food and clothing for my family.” Ayuba is not thinking about just this year; he said in 5 years, he wants to ensure other members of his community are lifted out of poverty.

loans.use: To access high quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Mika

texts.en: Mika is a 35-year- old farmer from Maimai. As a Babban Gona member, Mika, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Mika can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Mika is ambitious and is aiming to reap 100 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Mika said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Bala,   Hosea, and  Nuhu, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs.”With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
Jodelyn is 33 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jodelyn has been farming corn for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 34-year-old married woman from Bethlehem. She lives with her husband and seven kids; five sons and two daughters. All of them are under 18 years old. Her husband works as a construction worker where he gets an unstable income. Amani has her own business, which is a barn for raising sheep. She sells the meat and milk to the local traders.

Amani took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more sheep for her barn. By taking this loan, Amani will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. She appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 42-year-old lady who is married and the mother of five children aged between 24 and five years old. Her husband is a farmer and contributes to the total family income. She runs a retail shop which has been operational for the last 14 years.

Alice has grown with VisionFund through the years and now she has applied for her tenth loan with us, which she plans to use to add more stock of items like two bags of sugar, five cartons of cooking fat, five bales of flour and five cartons of bathing soap. She has seen that she currently has less stock of these items in her shop. She anticipates profits from this capital boost and she plans to use this to repay her loan.

In the future she wants to ensure her children have the best education available.

loans.use: to add more stock to her retail shop

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 54 years old and widowed with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elsie has been farming rice for 18 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 58 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Justina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Justina has been in this business for 40 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 21-year- old farmer from Maimai. As a Babban Gona member, Emmanuel, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Emmanuel can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the National average of 14. However, Emmanuel is ambitious and is aiming to reap 70 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Emmanuel said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Obadiya, Rejoice, and Kefas, and in 5 years, I want to ensure my children are educated and have professional jobs." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Floriphis

texts.en:
Floriphis is 39 years old and married with two children. For the past six years she has worked hard running her sari sari, or general store, as well as raising pigs.

Floriphis has previously borrowed and successfully paid off eighteen loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 18,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, cookies, candies, detergent, and shampoo. Her desire is to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari sari.

loans.name: Shahd Al- Asal Group

texts.en:
Shahd Al- Asal is a group which comprises four members of women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 125,000 YER from AMB.

Hajer is the leader of the group. She is a 32-year-old, living with her spouse in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is a very active and dynamic woman who likes to keep her house in the best condition. She has great determination to go ahead. Hajer works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the house. Most people purchase many kinds of food materials in this holy month ( Ramadan) in order to meet all the needs of breaking the fast. The people fast during the day in this month and they need delicious and good food. For this reason, Hajer wants financial support to purchase many kinds of food materials for the house in order to make delicious food for her family who fasts during the day. As a result, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB.



Hajer looks forward to building the second floor of her house and renovates the first one.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of food in order to make delicious food for her family who fasts during the day.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 45 years now.

Marina requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her business.

Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en: Yahaya is a dedicated farmer in Kaduna. As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members,Yahaya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Yahaya is ambitious and is aiming to reap yields above both the national and Babban Gona averages. When asked, Yahaya said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children; Ayuba,La'azaru and Musa." With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high-quality inputs in order to double yield and income

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en: Sophat is 37 years old, a farmer and a married woman with two children. She has been a farmer since 2002. One of her children is a worker and another is a student. Her husband is a coconut seller. They live in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. All of them can earn approximately $14.5 per day. Now Sophat would like to request a loan to build a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions. In the future, she is going to expand her husband’s coconut selling. We took her photo with her husband.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and married with one child. For the past year she has worked hard running her sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines. She is also a food vendor and earns extra income doing so.

Marites has previously borrowed and successfully paid off four loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy stock for her store such as groceries and personal care items. Her desire is to gradually expand her store through the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Luis Arnoldo

texts.es: Luis tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 7 años y 8 años de edad. Luis trabaja en una peluquería como cortador de cabello desde hace mucho tiempo. Luis desea construir el corredor de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, teja, vara de castilla, etc. Espera poder tener acceso a este financiamiento y así dar inicio a la construcción del corredor lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Luis is 34 years old, and he lives in his own house with his wife and his two children, ages seven and eight. Luis has been working as a hair-cutter in a barbershop for a long time. 

He wants to construct a corridor from the house, and this is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI. He will invest it in purchasing galvanized sheeting, tile, wooden rods, and similar items. He hopes to be able to have access to this financing, and begin building the corridor as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, tile, wooden rods, and similar items, in order to construct a corridor from his house.

loans.name: Mojahed

texts.en:
Mojahed is a 20-year-old single man from Attel, a village near Tulkarm. He lives with his family in a small house. He has a sheep barn which has been opened for the past year. He sells meat and milk to the local traders.

He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his business and fix the barn. By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. Mojahed appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his business and fix the barn.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Seen in this photo, Mohammad is 22 years old and lives in Attel, a village near Tulkarm. Unmarried, he lives with his family in a small house.

Five years ago Mohammad opened a sheep barn. He sells his sheep’s meat and milk to local traders.

Mohammad is applying for a 1,500 USD loan through FATEN, which he will use to buy more sheep and repair the barn. By taking this loan he will be able to increase his productivity and profits.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and repair his barn

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Se acerca la temporada de siembra de maíz, los agricultores se mueven diario desde muy temprano para limpiar la tierra, arar el terreno y hacer lo necesario para empezar la cosecha. Cesar es uno de estos grandes emprendedores, quien a sus 45 años, ha trabajado fuerte para estar hasta donde está, con ocho años como agricultor, a pesar de haber llegado hasta sexto grado de primaria. De vez en cuando, cambia su rastrillo por una bandeja, pues trabaja en ocasiones como mesero de un restaurante. Tiene como inspiración principal a su esposa y a sus dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 6 años, quienes estudian fuerte para terminar sus estudios.
Don Cesar inició su camino por el campo cultivando un poco de maíz con unos ahorros que tenía, luego decidió comenzar a vender elotes. Mientras pasaban los años, seguía ahorrando hasta comprar una vaca, las cuales se convirtieron poco a poco en varias. El apoyo de su esposa es esencial para él, pues juntos han logrado salir adelante vendiendo elotes cosidos y güirilas. Pero los sueños de Cesar no terminan ahí, pues desea seguir aumentando sus vacas y cosecha, para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar abono y pagar a los trabajadores de esta nueva cosecha de maíz y poder ofrecer un mejor producto.
texts.en:
Since the season for planting corn is approaching, farmers must start very early in order to clear their land, plow their fields, and do whatever is needed to begin the current harvest.  Cesar is one of these successful entrepreneurs.  At the age of 45, he has had to work hard to get to the point where he is today.  He has been working as a farmer for eight years, despite having only a sixth grade education.  When the time came, Cesar traded in a serving tray for a plow since he occasionally worked as a waiter at a restaurant.  His main inspiration comes from his wife and their two children, ages 19 and 6.  Both of his children are studying hard so that they can finish their education.  

Don Cesar started down the path as a farmer by planting a little bit of corn with some money he had saved.  Later he decided to begin selling corn on the cob.  As the years passed, he continued to save until he was able to buy a cow which gradually turned into several.  The support of his wife has been essential to Cesar.  Together they have been able to get ahead by selling corn on the cob, sewing, and preparing “güirilas” (white corn tortillas filled with crumbled cheese).  However, Cesar’s dreams don’t stop there.  He wants to keep increasing his herd of cows and his harvest.  For this reason, he needs a loan in order to buy compost and pay the workers who will be harvesting the new crop of corn.  This will enable him to offer a better product.

loans.use: to buy compost and pay workers who will be harvesting corn.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 62-year-old widow. She is blessed with seven adult children. For the past seven years she has run a grocery shop.

Lydia is applying for a 24,000 KES loan, her first, through VisionFund Kenya. With it she would like to open a jiko, or a small restaurant. She plans to use her anticipated profits to further grow her businesses.

In the future Lydia would like to open another retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a jiko, or small restaurant

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan de 39 años de edad,  estudio educación media,  esta acompañado su  compañera de vida se dedica a la elaboración de uniformes escolares mientras sus dos hijas estudian y por la tarde se dedican a los quehaceres del hogar, viven en la misma casa con sus padres los cuales de penden de él y su esposa ya que los dos trabajan.

Juan  desarrollo muchas actividades las cuales son,servicio como arbitro de la 3º división desde hace  9 años, también se dedica a la agricultura el cual tiene mucha experiencia en ambas actividades, la agricultura la realiza cerca de su casa y la otra viaja en autobús hasta la ciudad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para pagar las escrituras de un terreno a un abogado y la otra parte para comprar pollos y engordarlos para luego venderlos. 


 Sus sueños y proyecciones son construir su vivienda y preparar académicamente a sus 2 hijas  y hacer un cultivo de maíz para tener alimentación.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old and studied in secondary school. He is accompanying his life partner, who makes a living developing school uniforms while his two daughters study, and in the afternoon he does the housework. They live in the same house with their parents, who depend on him and his wife to both work.

Juan carries out many activities, such as an arbiter of the 3º division for 9 years, and also agriculture. He has a lot of experience in both activities. The agriculture is done close to his house, and the other he travels on a bus to the city.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is for the cancelation of a land deed (to his attorney), and also to buy chickens to fatten them and sell. This will be how he will pay the loan, as he hopes that with the profits will cancel out the loan.

His dreams and projections are to build his home, academically prepare his two daughters, and to cultivate corn for nourishment.

loans.use: to pay an attorney to cancel his land deed and to buy chickens to fatten them and sell to clients

loans.name: Gleyssy Massiel

texts.es:
“Mi negocio está más bonito” relata con orgullo Gleyssy. Posicionándola a sus tres años como una de las mejores pulperías del lugar. Madre de dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 1 año, casada con alguien quien siempre la ha apoyado. Afortunada por tener su título universitario y ser una microempresaria ahora.
Con emoción recuerda cuando su negocio era pequeño y ahora está sumamente feliz por ver cómo poco a poco va creciendo. Por esta razón, quiere seguir invirtiendo en ello, de manera que necesita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar papel higiénico, arroz, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas y otros productos que constantemente piden sus clientes. Esto le ayudará a tener un mejor servicio, lo cual le servirá para cumplir con su meta de crecer como mujer y como empresaria.
texts.en:
"My business is more beautiful," Gleyssy proudly tells, positioning it, at three years old, as one of the best general stores around.  She is mother of two children, ages six and one year, and married to someone who always supported her.  She is fortunate to have her university degree and to be a micro entrepreneur.  

With emotion, she remembers when her business was small, and now she is extremely happy to see how bit by bit it grows.  For this reason, she wants to continue investing in it, so she needs a new loan to buy toilet paper, rice, sugar, candy, soft drinks and other products, that her clients constantly ask for.  This will help her provide better service, which will help her meet her goal of growing as a woman and as entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy toilet paper, rice, sugar, candy, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy doors to close her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a 200 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester and biogas stove.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 45-year-old woman who is married to Josphat and blessed with three children. For the past ten years she has added to the household income by selling secondhand clothes, earning approximately 15,000 KES a month.

Alice was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer. She is now servicing a first loan of 20,000 KES, which she is using to buy additional used clothes such as dresses, skirts, T-shirts, sweaters, children’s clothes and men’s wear to sell.

Alice plans to use her anticipated profits to buy or open a clothing shop within her town. Her goal is to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Pumataki De Pilco Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “PUMATAKI DE PILCO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Paucartambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Paucartambo y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dionicia Amanda ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.



Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de ganadería, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members are part of the Communal Bank “Pumataki de Pilco” which is located in the District of Paucartambo in Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Dionicia Amanda.  She is 33 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children.  Dionicia works at her grocery business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She works from 8:00 A.M. to 10:00 P.M.  Dionicia has been in business for five years and is doing very well.  She dreams of expanding her grocery business.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice.  

The other members have businesses that involve raising livestock, selling animals, selling groceries, and selling food.  

Dionicia is grateful to those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice for her grocery business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 75-year-old lady who is currently widowed but was blessed with nine children. She has been a crop and livestock farmer for over 20 years and she gets a monthly profit of KES 10,000 every month. Most of her children are married and have started their own families but they also support her.

She is currently applying for her second loan with us and she plans to use this amount to buy some seeds, fertilizers, and farming equipment like hoes and rakes in preparation for the next planting season. She will use the anticipated profits to add more livestock to her farm.

She is happy with what she has been able to achieve and hopes to continue having a happy home.

loans.use: to add seeds, fertilizers, and some farming equipment

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old married man from Attel, a village near Tulkarem. He lives with his wife and five kids, three sons and two daughters, in a small house. 

He has a sheep barn which opened four years ago. He sells meat and milk to the local traders. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep for his barn. By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his productivity and also his income. Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Frincess

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Frincess works hard to support her family.

She has a  ready-to-wear vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Frincess is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Frincess has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 26 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase items to sell such as shampoo and other groceries.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 5 years. In the future Mary Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Wonderful lenders! Introducing to you Margaret, a loving, honest, and kind-hearted mother who is 36 years of age. She hails from Nandi hills area of Kenya, an area that has good weather patterns that support farming activities and also an area that is considered the best in tea growing. Margaret is a mother of four adorable children that she has raised through crop and animal farming. 

For eight years, Margaret has been doing farming and through those years she has managed to gather immense knowledge about farming and all the farming techniques are on her fingertips.

Nandi hills area has a high demand for milk and milk products and Margaret has always wanted to take advantage of the increased client base and market that is why she is seeking a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a dairy cow and be able to fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders Margaret is sure that aspiring women like her will be able to achieve their dreams and be able to become financially empowered. Profits from milk selling will be used in providing a solid future for her family and also providing the basic needs that her family will want.

Having gone through the repayment schedule, Margaret is sure of comfortably repaying the loan and in the future she has plans of opening a large dairy shop in her village where she will be packaging and selling milk to both wholesalers and retailers. Profits from this business will assure Margaret of a good future and as a woman she will be financially empowered.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is 46 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Merlina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Merlina has been in the pig fattening business for 6 years and earns additional income from planting flowers.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 40 years old and married with three children. Merlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Merlinda has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Merlinda aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos proviene de una familia de padres separados. Vive en Lima en el populoso distrito de Villa Maria del Triunfo, desde el que viaja muy temprano todas las mañanas durante 2 horas para poder asistir puntual a sus clases.
El vive con su madre y sus 2 hermanos, su padre los abandono cuando el apenas tenia 2 años y nunca se hizo cargo de ellos, sin embargo su madre a sabido sacarlos adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, ella se dedica a vender pescado de manera ambulante y esta deseosa de que Carlos pueda seguir estudiando para que pueda ser profesional, sin embargo esto sera posible solo con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva ya que el dinero no es suficiente para poder cubrir sus estudios.
Carlos estuvo costeándose sus gastos de educación gracias a que estaba realizando practicas pre profesionales por las que recibía una remuneración básica, pero estas ya terminaron por lo cual ya no cuenta con esa entrada de dinero.
Carlos desea agradecer a los beneficiarios de Kiva todo el apoyo que le puedan brindar para poder solventar sus estudios, el quiere decirles que estudiara mucho para salir bien en sus calificaciones y culminar con éxito sus cursos y que no los defraudara, que sera muy puntual en la devolución del dinero y que todo esto le servirá por sobretodo para ayudar en un futuro a su madre que tanto a sacrificado por el.
texts.en:
Carlos comes from a family with separated parents. He lives in Lima in the crowded district of Villa Maria del Triunfo from which he travels very early each morning, for 2 hours, to attend his classes on time.

He lives with his mother and two siblings. His father abandoned them when he was only 2 years old and never took care of them. Nonetheless, his mother has managed to support them with great sacrifice and effort. She makes a living selling fish as a street vendor and looks forward to Carlos being able to continue studying to be a professional. However, this will only be possible with the support of the Kiva lenders since they don’t have sufficient money to cover his education.

Carlos was paying for his educational costs thanks to pre-professional work he was doing for which he received basic pay but this has now ended which is why he no longer has that source of money.

Carlos wishes to thank the Kiva beneficiaries for all of the support they can provide him to be able to pay for his studies. He wants to tell them that he will study a lot to get good grades, successfully complete his courses and that he will not disappoint them. He will always be punctual in paying back the money and this will serve him overall in the future to help his mother, who has sacrificed so much for him.

loans.use: to pay for his studies to be a professional and help his mother.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoe-making materials such as shoe polish, inner soles, colors and glue for his business

loans.name: Jesus Argemiro

texts.es:
Jesús un hombre de 55 años de edad el cual comenzó con la actividad del campo a sus 8 años acompañando a su padre para aprender de la profesión que hoy en día le ha dado al alimentación a su familia conformada por sus 4 hijos ya que en una temporada para el olvido el invierno le ocasiono la perdida de sus cultivos y sufría por una dura separación con su esposa.
Solicita un crédito para iniciar sus cultivos de 0, con la particularidad de que quiere poner un sistema para resguardar sus terrenos y protegerlos contra el invierno, también comprara abonos y semillas y respecto a las plagas él prefiere erradicarlas naturalmente para no perjudicar sus campos. 
Este crédito será de gran ayuda para iniciar desde las cenizas lo que una vez fue sus hermosos campos de cultivo
texts.en:
Jesús is a 55 year old man who began work in the fields at eight years of age, accompanying his father to learn the occupation that today has provided food for his family of four children. In a time that he would rather forget, the winter cost him the loss of his crops and he suffered a difficult separation from his wife.

He is requesting a loan to replant his fields from scratch.  In particular, he wants to put in a system to protect his plots and to keep them safe against the winter. He will also buy fertilizer and seeds. With respect to insect infestations, he prefers to eradicate them naturally in order not to damage his fields.

This loan will be a great help to start again from the ashes of what once were his beautiful fields.

loans.use: to restart his agricultural business, buying fertilizer, seed and a cold weather shelter for his plants

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Triunfadoras  está en el 1er ciclo, están iniciando con muchas expectativas de invertir para poder tener más ingresos en la casa y así  poder salir de la pobreza. 
Una de ellas es la Sra. Karen, quien se dedica a hacer todo tipo de comidas, ella misma los prepara y luego sale a vender de forma ambulante, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado pero que con esfuerzo lo está logrando y va mejorando poco a poco.
Están recibiendo capacitaciones para poder administrar sus recursos de manera correcta. Karen pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con sus comidas, lo cual es su fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Triunfadoras  (Women Achievers) is in its first loan cycle. They are starting up with many expectations of investing as a way of having more income and, in this way, getting out of poverty. 

One of the members is Karen. She makes a living making all kinds of meals. She prepares them herself and then goes out and sells them as a street vendor. She says that this job is very demanding, but by working hard she is pulling it off and is improving, little by little. 

The group members are receiving training to manage their resources properly. 

Karen is asking for this loan so that she can buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, greens, and other supplies, in order to continue making food, which is her income source.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, vegetables, greens, and other supplies

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Las Vencedoras está en su ciclo 1 del programa de comités, también están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza que les permitirá poder conocer la situación de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zulma, quien se dedica a las ventas, ya que tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de productos que ella ofrece a sus clientes. Comenta que poco a poco se fue abriendo camino, ya que al principio le fue un poco difícil. 
La Sra. Zulma solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos varios para poder surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, condimento y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Las Vencedoras are in their first loan cycle with the communal bank program; they are also in a poverty elimination program that allows them to find out each of their situations and thereby improve their living conditions.  

One of this group's members is Zulma who works in sales; she has a small grocery store with all kinds of products available for her customers.  She tells us that, little by little, she has been making her way, as in the beginning it was a little difficult for her.  

Zulma is requesting this loan to buy various products to stock her small grocery store, such as vegetables, fruits, meat, condiments, and more, so she can keep working as she has been.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, condiments, and more

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín es de la ciudad de Asunción, vivía con sus padres pero luego de culminar su secundaria del Colegio se propuso como objetivo estudiar un oficio para luego trabajar por su cuenta.
Está estudiando para ser técnico en refrigeración, aspirando crear una microempresa aplicando la especialización que actualmente está cursando. Piensa que será exitoso y que una vez que emprenda el negocio tendrá resultados positivos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su curso.
texts.en:
Martin is from the city of Asuncion. He used to live with his parents, but after completing secondary school, he set himself the primary objective of learning  a trade, to then work on his own. He is presently studying to become a refrigeration technician. 

He aspires to create a microenterprise, applying the skills that he is presently studying. He thinks that he will be successful, and that he will get positive results once he starts the business.

He requests this loan to be able to invest in the payment of his school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres de Fe está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de grupo, ellas también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá conocer la situación de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder trabajar para salir adelante y crecer.
Maria es la presidenta de este grupo, ella comenta que siempre trata de poder guiar a sus compañeras por medio del ejemplo, ya que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante. Maria se dedica a la repostería,  comenta que siempre tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes que le piden todo tipo de productos.
Maria pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para seguir haciendo sus reposterías, como ser harina, levadura, dulces, leche y demás, y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres de Fe (women of faith) is in its 5th cycle of the group program. They are also doing the survey on eliminating poverty which allows each one to understand her particular situation and, based on the results, to work to get ahead and grow. 

Maria is the president of this group.  She says that she always tries to guide her fellow members by example, since she has always been working hard to get ahead. Maria runs a bake shop and states that she always has a lot of orders from her customers who ask for all kinds of products. She is asking for this loan so she can buy a variety of supplies such as flour, yeast, sweets, milk, etc. so she can continue making her confections and keep her business going as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sweets, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Los Alamos De V.e.s Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LOS ALAMOS DE V.E.S” una de ellas es la Sra. Alejandrina   de 45 años conviviente  y con 1  hijo, la Sra. Alejandrina se dedica ya hace 3 años a la venta de productos de limpieza  en un pequeño  mercado, todos los días con el merito de salir adelante, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Alejandrina    ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de sus hijo. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que sus hijo sea profesional es por eso  que la Sra. Alejandrina  trabaja mucho , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar mas productos de limpieza y  tener mas ingresos económicos. La Sra. Alejandrina  se le distingue por su casaca negra para la mano izquierda, a  la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
The members of the communal group, “Los Alamos De V.E.S.” are 5 responsible people who are engaged in different occupations.  One of them is Alejandrina, age 45. She lives with her partner, and she has one child.  Alejandrina has been selling cleaning products in a small market every day for three years, in order to get ahead.  Through her efforts she has been able to improve her home and support her child’s education. 

She wants to continue improving her business, and her greatest desire is that her child may become a professional—that is why she works a lot. With the loan that she has been given, she will invest in the purchase of more cleaning products, and have more income.  Alejandrina is on the left, distinguishable by her black jacket.  She sends a warm embrace to Kiva and EDAPROSPO; and she is grateful for the loan, as it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning products.

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es: Aurora con su anterior credikiva logró comprar mercancía en un mayor volumen y así obtuvo mejores precios. Hoy trabaja con más comodidad y agradece a Kiva por su ayuda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento mediante el cual comprará artículos como ropa y calzado además de accesorios femeninos, que han llegado en las guías especializadas de productos en promoción. Con ellos sorprenderá a su clientela para que sus ventas se incrementen.
texts.en: With Aurora's previous loan she was able to purchase a larger volume of merchandise and she was able to get better prices. Now she works more comfortably and is grateful to Kiva for the support provided. She is applying for a new loan to buy clothing, shoes and feminine accessories which have shown up in specialized guides for products on promotion. With these articles she will surprise her customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase articles such as clothing and shoes, as well as feminine accessories.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 39-year-old lady who is married to Dominic and they are blessed with one child who is six years old. Annah has been running a tailoring shop for the last ten years  and making a monthly income of KES 12,000.

She has applied for her fourth loan with us and she plans to use this amount to add more stock of fabric as she has seen that her clients enjoy having varieties to choose from. Her clients are also changing with the trends and so she hopes to capitalize on these changes. She anticipates making profits which she will save towards supporting her family.

In the future, Annah would like to expand her business further and educate her child.

loans.use: to add more fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Lenders! Meet Regina, a hardworking mother who is 28 years of age and full of energy. She hails from the Litein area of Kenya, an area that is blessed with good weather patterns and a good place to buy land so that one can start farming activities.

She is married and has been blessed with six lovely children that she really loves. Regina is a very hardworking woman and she always says, “My parents taught me to work hard from a young age and now I am independent.” Through hard work she has been able to practice mixed farming, growing crops and practicing dairy farming, which has helped her to always put food on the table for her children and family. 

The Litein area of Kenya has a ready market for milk but the supply is low. This is because the population is high and the supply can’t cater to everybody. That is why Regina has always wanted to keep more dairy cows because she is assured that she will reap more profits. Because of the above valid reasons, she is kindly requesting a loan of KES 57,200 to buy a dairy cow and through the loan she will be sure that her business will flourish and she will get more income.

Because of having a large family, Regina requires more capital to feed them and hence this loan will assist her in feeding the six stomachs that always depend on her.

Being a visionary mother, Regina plans to open a business of selling milk and she is sure that, through the profits earned, her children will never lack and her life will be stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es:
José es un cafetero que ha ejercido su profesión por más de 20 años brindando productos saludables y sanos para el consumo de las personas. 
A sus 38 años edad se ha trazado con su esposa poder brindarles a sus hijos una excelente calidad de vida y educación.
Es un padre amoroso y muy responsable, sus hijos se han convertido en su mayor motivación y fuente de alegría.
El desea darle a su familia siempre lo mejor, por esta razón quiere mejorar su negocio, aumentar su productividad y asegurar un futuro en base a trabajo en el campo; solicita un apoyo para la compra de insumos agrícolas para realizar el mantenimiento a sus tierras, el crédito lo invertirá en fertilizantes, abonos y semillas con los que quiere comenzar una nueva era en sus cultivos.
texts.en:
José is a coffee grower who has been exercising his professional for more than 20 years providing healthy and safe products for people's consumption. At 38 years old he has planned with his wife to provide their children with an excellent quality of living and education. He is a loving and responsible father. His children have become his major source of motivation and his source of happiness. 

He always wants to give his family the best and for this reason he wants to improve his business. He would like to augment his productivity and secure his future on the basis of his work in the field. He is requesting help to buy agricultural inputs to maintain his land. He will invest the loan in buying fertilizer, manure and seeds with which he will start a new era in his farming.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia vive con sus hijos en la ciudad de La Paz.
Patricia es Licenciada en derecho. Patricia tiene un problema con una pared de su cocina, sucede que la pared  comunica con el patio y tiene rajaduras, a eso se suma el hecho de que las lluvias estan causando deterioros por la humedad, entonces Patricia quiere un prestamo para arreglar la pared de su cocina para que sus hijos tengan  un hogar acogedor.

El sueño de Patricia es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para adquirir su propio Estudio Jurídico y tener mejores ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su Familia.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her children in the city of La Paz.

Patricia has a law degree. Patricia has a problem with a wall in her kitchen that is connected to the patio because the rain and humidity have caused it to crack and deteriorate. She wants this loan to be able to repair this wall, and in this way, give her children an inviting home. 

Patricia's dream is to be able to gather enough money to rent her own law office and have better income to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair a wall in her kitchen to give her children a safe home

loans.name: Gulsun

texts.ru:
Гулсун является профессиональной швеей, проживающей в городе Худжанд. Более 10 лет она занимается пошивом национальных и европейских женских платьев. Гулсун сейчас 48 лет. У нее уже взрослые дети. Ее сыну 29 лет, а дочери 27 лет. Сын работает сварщиком, а дочь помогает матери в ее швейном деле. Она тоже унаследовала у матери талант шитья. А муж Гулсун в данный момент находится вдали от семьи, он работает в России.
Гулсун хочет расширить деятельность. Ей нужна новая модернизированная швейная машинка и поэтому она обратилась за кредитом. Она нуждается в финансовой поддержке для развития своего дела.
texts.en:
Gulsun is a professional seamstress, living in the city of Khujand. She has been involved in sewing national and European women's dresses for over 10 years. Gulsun is currently 48 years old. She has grown children. Her son is 29 years old, and daughter is 27 years old. Her son works as a welder, and daughter helps the mother with the sewing business. She also inherited her mother's talent for sewing. And Gulsun's husband is currently far away from the family - he works in Russia.

Gulsun wants to expand her business. She needs a new, modern sewing machine and this is why she requested this loan. She needs financial support to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a new, modern sewing machine

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy cloth and sewing materials for her tailoring business.

Lanie has been in this business for 7 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dry goods. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now has she requested for an additional loan to further build her business.

Lanie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Seyaj Mosmi Group

texts.en:
Seyaj Mosmi is a group which is comprised of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Jamila is the leader of the group. She is a 35-year-old married woman, living with her spouse in their own  house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is very active and dynamic. She works as a housewife and her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. 

Most people purchase many kinds of food materials for their houses in this holy month (Ramadhan) in order to meet all the needs of the fast-breaking. The people fast during the day this month and they need to have delicious and good food for their fast-breaking in the evening. For this reason, Jamila hopes to get of a mount of money to prepare the house with all kinds of food materials in order to make delicious food for her family who fast in the day. 

As a result, she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase food materials to meet all the needs of the house.  Jamila looks forward to building the second floor of her house and renting the first one in order to improve the living condition of the family. She hopes to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: to purchase food materials to meet all the needs of the house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Judith, a very hardworking woman, an honest and loving mother who is 32 years of age. Judith resides in the Litein area of Kenya, an area that was blessed with good weather patterns. This is because there is always enough rainfall that supports crop and animal farming. Judith has been doing farming for the past five years and through hard work she has managed to always make profits throughout those years.

Judith is very passionate about dairy farming and she loves taking care of the environment. This is why she has planted trees in her compound which help in keeping her farm beautiful. Because of the love that she has for animals, she has even nicknamed one of his dairy cow “Seroi” and through dairy farming she has been able to gather and accumulate more income. 

She is a very enterprising woman, and because of the adequate space that is in her compound, she wants to start keeping goats and sheep. That is why she is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to be able to make her dream come to reality. Goat and sheep keeping requires a large space and Judith has got space in her farm that will cater to that; hence she is sure that through this, she will reap more profits.

Judith intends to be selling dairy goat milk which has high demand and fetches so many profits, and through the extra income from this loan, she will change her living conditions and provide a secure future for her family.

She plans to start a dairy shop where she will be selling goat milk and also a butchery which sells goat meat, and through these two ventures, she is sure of comfortably paying back the loan and improving her living standards.

loans.use: To buy a goat and a sheep

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married mother of one child not yet in school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For over five years, Masika has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, Masika wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for use in the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Beverlyne

texts.en:
Beverlyne is 26 years old, married and blessed with one child. Her husband is a businessman. She operates a school which has been in existence for the last five years. She has been able to provide education to needy families in her area at a subsidized cost and she is able to make an income that can comfortably support her family.

She just joined VisionFund kenya and has applied for her first loan as she would like to accommodate more children. She plans to use this money to buy more desks and chairs for her students and teachers. She hopes to be able to make good profit so that she can build more classrooms.

In the future, she would like to educate her child to the highest level possible as well as be the best education provider in her area.

loans.use: To purchase desks and chairs for her school

loans.name: Isah Abdu

texts.en: Isah Abdu is a 50-year-old farmer from Ba'awa.  As a Babban Gona member, Isah Abdu, is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist.  Like all Babban Gona members, Isah Abdu can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare,  double the national average of 14. However, Isah Abdu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Isah Abdu said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: lmrana, Abdul,and Mahamadu, and in 5 years, I want to make more money for myself and my family.” With this loan, he is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married mother of three children, all in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transportation. 

For the past five years, she has operated a detergent-selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 40,00,0 she wants to purchase liters of detergent for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase liters of detergent for resale

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Abdu like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Abdu, is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Abdu expressed that “In 5 years, I want to ensure other members of my community are lifted out of poverty.” With this loan, Abdu is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs that could double yield

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Jane, an ever-smiling mother who is 43 years of age and very charming. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, an area that   experiences favorable weather patterns that favor crop and animal farming. Jane's major sources of income are selling milk and farming crops, and she also does some small business so that she can make ends meet.

Jane has practiced farming for the past three years. She never regrets starting farming because through the profits that she has been making, she has taken care of her family and paid tuition fees for her four children. Jane’s farm is located along the river, where she grows vegetables and maize. The main challenge she has been facing is watering the farm using water from the rive. 

This is why she is kindly seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a water pump. With the water pump she will be able to irrigate her farm and therefore increase her vegetable production; hence, this will increase profits because there will be a bumper harvest in her farm. Vegetable farming requires a lot of water and this water pump will be of so much help because water will be pumped directly from the river to the farm, assuring Jane of a bumper harvest. This water will also be used for home consumption and will improved Jane's living conditions.

Jane's vision is to be able to open a large vegetable-selling business where she will reap more profits and assure her family of a secure future and her children of a good education.

loans.use: To buy a water pump

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 58-year-old married mother of three. Forty two years ago, she started working as a tailor. Because of this experience, her customers trust and support her. That encouraged her in 2002 to establish her existing business. Most of Fatima's customers are neighbors, relatives and friends.

Fatima is a hard-working woman who sacrifices her life for the sake of her children. Fatima has been an Al Majmoua borrower for 10 loans, and almost all of her loans were used to pay for treatment of her child's illness. 
Her previously Kiva-funded loan was invested in buying a new tailoring machine, which developed her business properly.

Fatima is applying for a loan this time to improve her business by refurbishing two tailoring machines she has for better production. These two machines are very important for her business development and to increase her income.
She hopes to stay healthy and capable of covering almost all of her family's needs.

loans.use: To refurbish two tailoring machines she has for better production

loans.name: Zuura

texts.ru: Зуура, 38 лет, вдова, многодетная мать, у нее 2 сына и 2 дочери. Несмотря на то, что Зуура осталась одна с детьми, она не пала духом и не сидит сложа руки, в поисках доходов для своей семьи она начала заниматься разведением скота, стартовав 10 лет назад с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду и терпеливому характеру на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошее хозяйство - 1 дойная корова и теленок. Зуура реализует молочную продукцию местным жителям. Домашнее вкусное молоко пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Зуура обратилась в Банк  «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух дойных коров. Сегодня ее прибыль составляет в среднем 10,000  сом (KGS) в месяц, этого катастрофически не хватает на жизнь и содержание детей. А прибыль от реализации молока и молочной продукции позволит Зууре развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Zuura is 38 years old, a widow and has 2 sons and 2 daughters. Despite the fact that Zuura was left alone with the children, she did not despair and sit with her hands down. In search of a source of income for her family, she got involved in breeding livestock 10 years ago with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her back-breaking work and patient character, today she has a good business with 1 dairy cow and a calf. Zuura sells milk products to local residents. Fresh, delicious milk is in high demand, and this is why Zuura requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy two dairy cows. Today her average monthly profit amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). The profit from selling milk and dairy products would allow Zuura to develop her business and improve her family's welfare.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old, hardworking woman. She is married to John, who adds additional income, and they are blessed with six children. Grace has been operating a grocery stall for fourteen years, earning an income of 8,000 KES every month.

Grace was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now requesting her first loan of 15,000 KES. She intends to use the entire amount to buy additional stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions, carrots, potatoes and fruits, which are running out in her stock.

Grace plans to use the anticipated income to buy a dairy cow as well as to start a poultry business, and she hopes to become a successful woman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is a single woman. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

Mgeni operates a clothes-selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be seasonality. Mgeni dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem, age 32, runs a small low-income secondary school. She started the school some years ago with just 14 children with the aim of promoting education in her locality.  Now, the number of students is around 200 (more than half of these students are girls). She needs to meet the growing demands of this increasing number of children, but she faces financial difficulties as the school is not making much profit and her husband has incurred losses in his business. She has asked the Kashf Foundation for a loan of 100,000 PKR so that she can purchase furniture to replace the plastic folding chairs currently being used in the classrooms. This will be a step towards improving the school.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her school.

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en: Iliya remembers not being able to feed his family during a particularly bad harvest. This is before he became a Babban Gona Member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Iliya like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the National average of 14. However, Iliya,  is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season.  Iliya expressed that “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, Iliya is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To purchase high quality inputs that could double yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for his barn.

loans.name: Gulnura

texts.ru: Гульнуре 38 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, после смерти мужа, кормильца семьи в поиске доходов для своей семьи Гульнура стала заниматься оказанием парикмахерских услуг в салоне красоты. Бизнес начала с 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря ее непосильному труду Гульнура достигла больших успехов и получает прибыль  в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. На сегодняшний день у Гульнуры уже есть своя постоянная клиентура, однако не хватает инструментов и оборудования. Поэтому Гульнура обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку фенов и прочей фурнитуры для оказания парикмахерских услуг. Доходы от кредита Гульнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своей деятельности, она мечтает открыть свой собственный салон красоты.
texts.en: Gulnura is 38 years old, a widow and a mother of 3 children. She has a higher education, and has been the sole provider for her family after her husband's death. In search of a source of income for her family, she got involved in providing hair styling services at a beauty salon. She started the business with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her back-breaking work, Gulnura achieved a lot of success and earns a monthly profit of 40,000 som (KGS). Today Gulnura already has regular clients, but does not have enough tools and equipment. This is why Gulnura requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy hair dryers and other equipment for providing hair styling services. Gulnura plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business; she dreams of opening her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers and other equipment for providing hair styling services

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en: Wilber is a male client aged 37 years. He is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for his tea plantation. He is a tea grower with tea plantations as his main business. He is married with four children, all of whom attend school. As he is hard working, he also trades in produce; and has a retail shop, a motorcycle (which he uses as bodaboda) business, and a hotel to supplement his income. He started business in 2004 to earn income to look after his family. His business is being carried out from his local area in Buhweju District and his clients are tea traders who have enabled him to progress further. He is faced with the challenge of poor weather conditions but is determined to continue working hard to achieve his plans. He hopes to educate all his children for a better future. After getting a loan he hopes to use the money efficiently to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Iliya Eli

texts.en: Iliya is a 53-year-old farmer from Yan Gwari.  As a Babban Gona member, Iliya is excited about the opportunity to finally have access to credit, good markets and a trained agronomist. Like all Babban Gona members, Iliya can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the average Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Iliya is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. When asked, Iliya said “I plan to use the money I make to educate my children: Obadiah, Nehemiah, and Matta, and in 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community.” With this loan, she is well on his way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Safiratu

texts.en: Safiratu remembers the starvation her family faced during a particularly bad harvest. This was before she became a Babban Gona member. Now, as a Babban Gona member, Safiratu, like all Babban Gona members, can earn up to $2000/ha this season from growing maize, more than three times the Nigerian farmer’s annual income. The average Babban Gona farmer yields 30 bags/hectare, double the national average of 14. However, Safiratu is ambitious and is aiming to reap 35 bags per hectare this season. “In 5 years, I want to become the most profitable farmer in my community”, expressed Safiratu.  With this loan, she is well on her way to achieving this dream.

loans.use: To access high-quality inputs such as fertilizer and seed in order to double income and yield

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for school fees

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested for a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo and groceries.

Meriam has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from fishing.

Meriam aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
HELLO WONDERFUL LENDERS! Meet Bornes, a 21-year-old mother who is very determined to succeed. Bornes is married and has one child who is very lovely. Bornes hails from Nandi Hills, Kenya; an area that gets good rainfall and has favorable weather patterns for farming. Bornes is very hard working and has been farming for the past 3 years. From the profits she has earned she has provided for her family the basic needs in life.

Bornes is from a humble background and her upbringing was challenging. She does not want this to repeat itself, and that is why she is doing anything positive that she can to have a good life and a secure future for her child.

Bornes is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to buy poultry and start poultry farming. This will improve her income level and she will be able to assure her child of a more secure future by being able to pay tuition fees for him. Through selling eggs and poultry products in the nearby market she is sure to reap more profits. This is because there is already a demand for eggs in the local market.

Being an aspiring woman Bornes will greatly benefit from the loan because it will open doors for her to progress in life.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad, a 40-year-old vigorous mother of eight, has been stitching clothes for the people of her community for many years. She uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to a lack of funds, Shamshad is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is therefore requesting a loan of Rs 40,000 to buy more spools of threads in various colors, packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will be her third loan from Kashf Foundation, and it will enable her to increase her income. Shamshad is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in various colors,  packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Norn Group

texts.en:
Norn is a 24-year-old mother of one child. A farmer since 2008, she is married to a garment worker. They live in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, and both can earn approximately $8 per day. 

Norn is requesting a loan as part of a group of four, and she will use her portion to build a latrine. This loan will help her live in better conditions. 

In the future, Norn plans to buy a Tuk Tuk taxi (a motor with a trailer) for her husband to run, renovate her house and support her child to achieve a university education.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Danaya 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA 2 est constitué de 10 femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à TIEFAGALA, un des villages de BOUGOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles hivernale. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
Le  riz est la spéculation cultivée de SOUMBA, la  4ème femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence,  payer les frais de labour  et de sarclage pour exploiter 1hectare. 
La production sera vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 60.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de rembourser son prêt et  d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
The Danaya 2 group is composed of 10 married women averaging 32 years of age, with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Tiefagala, a village in Bougouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural business in the rainy season.

They are on their fourth loan with the institution, having duly repaid their prior loan. Soumba, the fourth one standing from right to left in the photo, grows rice.
With her loan she plans to buy agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and seeds and to pay the cost of labor and weeding to work one hectare [2 acres] of land.
After harvesting, the produce will be sold at the market in the village to  a mixed clientele

She plans to earn 60,000 West African francs per agricultural cycle. This revenue will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with everyday household expenses.

loans.use: to cover the cost of agricultural inputs and seeds as well as labor and weeding.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: install electricity in his home

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Susan has requested for a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Susan has been pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain this business.

In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru: Гульнар 51 год, замужем, 4 детей. У Гульнар высшее педагогическое образование, она работает в школе учительницей, а также с 2004 года вместе с супругом занимаются торговлей товаами широкого потребления. Также имеется доход от предоставления компьютерных услуг, в своем гараже Гульнар создала все условия для местной ребятни, они любят приходить поиграть в разные компьютерные игры. Компьютеры в селе есть не у всех, поэтому эта деятельность Гульнар приносит хороший доход. Однако основной деятельностью Гульнар является  именно торговля, она уже достраивает более просторный магазин и решила увеличить ассортимент в товарообороте. Поэтому Гульнар обратилась в Банк  «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров широкого потребления. На сегодняшний день, ежемесячная прибыль составляет примерно 20,000 сомов, а товарооборот свыше 120,000 сомов (KGS). Доходы от кредита Гульнар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на образование младшего сына.
texts.en: Gulnar is 51 years old married, with four children. Gulnar has a college degree in education. She works as a secondary school teacher. In addition, since 2004, she and her husband sell mass consumptiongoods. They also earn an income from providing computer services. In her garage, Gulnar arranged everything for the local youngters, who like to come there to play computer games. Not everyone in their village owns a computer, which is why this business brings a good income to Gulnar. However, her main business is retail. She is now expanding her store and decided to offer a wider assortment of goods. This is why Gulnar has turned to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the maount of 120,000 KGS to buy consumer goods. At present, her monthly revenue is about 20,000 KGS and the sales volume is over 120,000 KGS. Gulnar plans to invest the revenues resulting from her loan  into a further expansion of her business, and eventually save up for her youngest son's education.a

loans.use: to buy consumer goods for resale in a private shop in order to increase  her product assortment.

loans.name: Tweyambe Ssanje Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area and is comprised of eight members: Jimmy, Kizitto, Harriet, Pascal, Experito, Florence, Florence, Harriet. They are involved in different activities which include: farming, retail, passion fruits farming, produce trading, and market vending.

Kizitto is a married man, age 30, with three children, two of whom attend school. He runs a textile business and also does farming as a side business. He started his business in 2011 to improve his and the family's standard of living. 

Kizitto acquired the loan to boost his textile business through buying rolls of clothing to sell to his clients. His clients are people from nearby areas and residents. 

He hopes to build rentals and to to enlarge the textile business. His challenge is lacking capital and he describes himself as being a trustworthy and hard-working man who appreciates the services that lenders offer.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Es un día muy caluroso, el mercado mayor de Sololá está repleto de personas que van y vienen, unos comprando otros vendiendo.  La esperanza baila entre los dos grupos.

De los que venden, se encuentra Vicente, de 31 años y soltero, pero casado con la esperanza, esa que lo mantiene fresco durante días calurosos en el mercado desde hace 10 años dedicado a la venta de Jaspiado: hilos especiales para trajes típicos,  de quien lo aprendió de un vecino de su localidad. 

El calor no turbia su sueño para seguir capitalizando su negocio de Jaspiado.  Pero necesita otro factor importante para seguir adelante,  necesidad que lo mueve a gestionar un préstamo.
texts.en:
It's a sweltering day. The large market of Sololá is full of people coming and going, buying and selling. Hope dances between the two groups.

Among those selling, you find Vicente, 31 years old and single, but married to his hope, which keeps him cool on hot days in the market. For ten years, he's been in the business of selling jaspiado, a special tie-dyed yarn used for traditional textiles, which he learned from a neighbor at his location.

The heat doesn't disturb his dream of continuing to fund his jaspiado sales - but he does need one important thing to keep going: he needs this loan.

loans.use: with cash flow for his business selling traditional yarns

loans.name: Reina Maribel

texts.es: Reina de 27 años de edad es madre soltera, vive con su grupo familiar y sus 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad. Ella es una mujer luchadora que todos los días sale muy temprano hacia el mercado a ganarse la vida con la venta de verduras y hortalizas que realiza. Reina desea hacer algunas mejoras a su vivienda ya que se encuentra  deteriorada como se observa en la fotografía por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina, madera y clavos para reparar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Reina, age 27, is a single mother. She lives with her family and her two children, ages 9 and 7. She's a woman with a fighting spirit who gets up early every day to earn a living by selling vegetables and produce at the market. Reina wants to make some improvements to her home, as it's starting to deteriorate, as you can see in the picture. She's requesting the loan from FUSAI, which she will use to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails, and repair the roof of her home.

loans.use: buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair her roof
